Molly has successfully finished paying back her loan. Sorry for any inconveniences caused for not having posted her last payments earlier.

loans.name: Sandra Raquel

texts.en:
I work selling clothes, I do not have a permanent post within the market, but the authorities allow me to sell my items near the market. I have been selling clothes in this area for three years, and so people know me and buy my clothes. With my earnings I help my children with their studies.

Loan Use: Purchase of blouses, underwear, T-shirts and other items.

Mi actividad es la venta de ropa, no tengo un puesto fijo dentro del mercado pero las autoridades me permiten vender en las aceras cerca del mercado. Tengo 3 años de vender en esta zona, por lo que varias personas ya me conocen y me compran ropa. Con las ganancias que obtengo de las ventas ayuda a mis hijos en sus estudios escolares.

loans.use: Venta de blusas, ropa interior, camisetas y otros

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.en: En mi comunidad me conocen por Hilda, soy comerciante y dueña de un negocio ubicado en una Plaza llamada San Sebastian. Tengo cinco años de tener mi tienda la que me ha generado ganacias y ayudar a mis dos hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Venta de ropa y cosmeticos

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.en:
My prinicipal activity is cooking foods and baking egg-yolk bread. My business is located in my home in the community Quebrada Larga. My earnings help me to support my children with their studies and in daily family expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase flour, beans, sugar, salt, vegetables, rice, oil and other items.

Mi actividad principal es la elaboracion de comidas y pan de yema, el negocio lo tengo ubicado en mi casa de habitacion en la Comunidad de Quebrada Larga. Los ingresos que he recibido me han ayudado apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios y en los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de harina, frijoles, azucar, sal, vegetales, arroz, aceite y otros

payments.comment: Gracias por su ayuda, ahora necesito capital fresco para poder mejorar mi negocio.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.en:
I work selling chicken, dairy products and slices of fried plantains. I go to work on my motorcycle every day to sell my products to nearby pulperias ( cafe/supply stores)and also those in neighboring communities. My wife tends to the sales at home. I have been selling my produce for one year and it helps me to maintain my family.

Loan Use: Purchase of chicken, plantains, cheese, butter and "queso fresco" ( a traditional white cheese of South and Central America).

Me dedico a la venta de pollo, lacteos y tajadas de platano fritas. Salgo en mi motocicleta todos los dias a vender en las pulperias cercanas y de otras comunidades vecinas. Mi esposa atiende las ventas en la casa, tengo 1 año de dedicarme a esta actividad que me ayuda a mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de pollo, platanos, queso, mantequilla y quesillo.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Norma and I have been selling groceries such as milk, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar and other items of daily consumption. My business is located in my house in the community Quebrada Larga, I am a single mother and with my earnings I help my three children, who are all school aged.

Loan Use: Purchase of eggs, sugar, coffee, bread, beans, rice, butter and other items.

Me llamo Norma y me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo basico como leche, huevos, pan, cafe, azucar y otros productos de consumo diario. Mi negocio esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion en Quebrada Larga, soy madre soltera y con los que vendo ayudo a mis tres hijos que estan en edad escolar.

loans.use: Compra de huevos, azucar, cafe, pan, frijoles, arroz, manteca y otros

loans.name: Blanca Lilian

texts.en:
Ah! the tortilla is an important staple of honduran cuisine. I have been making corn tortillas for five years, the earnings help me finance the studies of my three children. Every day my children help me to grind and to form the tortillas and also to deliver them to the homes of my clients. Now, I need to increase my earnings because one of my children is enrolled in the University and I want him to graduate so that he can help with his brothers.

Loan Use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime.

Ah!!! la tortilla un complemento importantisimo en la comida hondureña, tengo 5 años de dedicarme a la elaboracion de tortillas de maiz, las ganancias me han ayudado con los estudios de mis 3 hijos. Cada dia mis hijos me ayudan a moler y hacer tortillas y otro a entregarlas en las casas de mis clientes. Ahora necesito incrementar mis ganacias ya que uno de mis hijos ingreso a la Universidad y quiero que se gradue para que ayude a sus hermanos.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, leña, cal.

loans.name: ´tony´jose Antonio

texts.en:
I have nearly 20 years of experience in making barbecue tacos (my favoriate Mexican Food!) in a small trailer. This business has been my principal source of living for me, my wife, and my children.

Unfortunately, due to a strong storm that recently whipped through Nuevo Laredo, my small trailer was severely damaged and my ingredients for making tacos were rotten when the storm ended. That is why I am asking for support to help rebuild my trailer and buy new equipment to heat the food for my customers. This loan will help me to continue generating income that will allow me to support the needs of my family.

I would like to ask for a loan of $950 dollars. More specifically, this loan money will be used for the reconstruction of my trailer and to purchase the necessary equipment for my kitchen operation. And if there are left over funds, I wish to purchase some more ingredients to meet the needs of my customers.

Thank you Kiva Lenders!

Español

Tengo casi 20 años de experiencia en la elaboración del tacos de barbacoa (mi comida mexicana favorita) en pequeño remolque. Este negocio ha sido mi fuente principal de vida para mi esposa, mis niños y propia. Desafortunadamente, debido a una fuerte tormenta que azotó recientemente en Nuevo Laredo, mi pequeño remolque fue dañado seriamente y de la misma manera los los ingredients. Por lo cual estoy pidiendo ayuda para reconstruir mi remolque y a comprar equipo nuevo para calentar los alimentos y seguir vendiendo a mis clientes. Este préstamo me ayudará a continuar generando ingresos que permitirá cubrir las necesidades de mi familia. Me gustaria solicitar un préstamo de $950 dólares. Y pagarlo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, este dinero será utilizado para la reconstrucción de mi remolque el equipo necesario para calendar alimento en la cocina del remolque y si sobre fondos, deseo comprar algo de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos y asi poder seguir vendiendo a mis clientes. Gracias por su ayuda.

loans.use: trailer rebuild, buy heat and cook equipment and some ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of two and she is aged 53 years. She is a retired clinical officer and an active member of Konguini Jisaidie. The group has been working with WEEC for the last four years. Since she joined the group for years ago, she has borrowed four loans and paid very well. 
Susan started her business in 2003; she sells new clothes which she buys from Nairobi and some from Tanzania such as Vitenge. Currently, her business is worth USD1200 and it continues to grow. Her average sales range from USD300-500 per month. This is a season for those who sell clothes because all farmers have finished harvesting and are now selling. Also, Christmas is around the corner and some people shop early not to be over charged in December.

loans.use: Susan wants to buy dresses, skirts, blouses and shirts for men such that she does not experience stock outs.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Two of her children are in college and the rest in secondary school. She has raised her children single handedly because her husband is bedridden. Eunice runs two businesses, a retail shop and a stone quarry. She started business in 1993; she employs 3 casual laborers who assist her mainly in the stone quarry. The retail shop sells house hold commodities such as sugar, rice, salt, soap, wheat flour, maize flour to mention but a few. She earns about $150 per month; this in relation to her expenses is not enough. Therefore, she will have to use a loan to keep her business running. She has been able to build a permanent house and looks forward to building rental rooms when her children finish school.

loans.use: Eunice would like to restock her shop mainly with sugar, wheat flour, rice, soap and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the Vice Chairlady of Konguini Jisaidie women group. She is a member of Muranga District Agricultural Board in charge of Muranga town area. She is a strong and honest woman when it comes to repaying the loans in her group. She has repaid 3 loans of $300, 500 and 700, and this contributed in approving an additional loan of $900.

Besides Mary being a poultry farmer, she also grows maize and beans. After harvesting, she supplies beans and maize to neighboring schools as well as neighbors. She harvests about 20 bags of maize corn and beans. She rears 200 broilers at a time and each crop takes 40 days to mature. She sells a 90kg bag of maize at $70 and a 90kg of beans $40 to her customers. Also she sells broilers at $2.80 cents to traders and neighbors. She also rears Milk goats which provide the family with milk and children like it very much. On average she is able to make a profit of about $328 per season.

She has been an active member, thus being able to repay the past loans on time and acts now as a mentor to other group members. She intends to renovate the poultry house with $147; $22 to buy dairy goats, $515 to buy 500 chicks, $158 to buy 4 bags of starter feeds and drugs.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy 500 one day old chicks, 2 dairy goats, chichen feeds and to renovate her chichen house.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 54 years old married with a family of 5 children. She is the group and Anglican Church Treasurer as well as the Mothers Union Chairlady. She also works for Kenya Generation Company. She is committed in leadership and Empowering women in her area. She supplements her salary by selling eggs from her Poultry business.  She collects and sells 5 trays of eggs per day at $3 per tray. She also has a cow which gives her milk for sale and home consumption. She sells between 17 – 20 litres of milk per day giving her about USD225 every monthly. This business has helped her in educating her children and maintaining the family. Rearing more chicken will increase her earnings and this will make her live a comfortable life.

loans.use: Loise would like to buy 400 chicks and chicks mash.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She is a secondary teacher by profession. She is a very hardworking and a committed group member who has been able to get 5 loans previously and repaid them all very well.

She has a medium wholesale\Retail shop and her current stock is about USD 2200. She has stocked all sorts of food stuff and household utilities. She makes monthly sales of about USD 440 by selling sugar, rice, cooking fat, cooking oil, various kinds of detergents, wheat flour and soft drinks. Maintaining the right stock keeps the business running properly and profits will be realized. This brings more customers because they will be satisfied with the services and will tell others.

loans.use: Nancy wants to stock sugar, cooking fat, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize to be able to serve all her customers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She started a hair salon in Kiserian town in 2003. She started by plaiting hair and her main customers were school going children and young secondary school girls. In 2004 she joined church road Women Group that works with WEEC. She attended the initial training before receiving a loan. After the training, she was given a loan of USD 117. She bought braids and cosmetics for hair treatment. She improved her work very well and customers increased and kept coming back. She paid up her loan with ease and received another of loan of $200, which she used to buy a drier and cosmetics. She worked hard and paid it too, right now she has two driers and employs one person who assists her in all the work. Mean while, she is building a semi-permanent house in Rongai and its being funded by the business. She is looking forward to a beautiful home and a prosperous business if this kind of assistance is continuously given.

loans.use: Catherine wants to buy different types of hair weaves, wigs, shampoos and other beauty products.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Norma was 14 years old when she learned to sew. She had to work in a clothing factory near her house to support her family and she began as an assistant. In addition, her sister taught her to make flower bouquets a long time ago. Four years ago, she decided to contribute to the family economy because her husband is a construction worker and his income is very variable. Due to this situation, she started her business where she combined her efforts and started selling both her clothes and flower bouquets. She is fortunate to be supported by her husband.

A few months ago, she bought a truck to facilite the supply of the raw materials and diminish its transportation costs because she buys the fabrics in different stores in town. But she buys the flowers in the city of Saltillo, an hour distance from her. Now she needs a loan for $925 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. If given the loan, she will take advantage of the increase of demand because the next season is very popular. More specifically, she will invest in flowers for the next seasonal fest “Día de Muertos” because it is one of the best seasons of the year.

ESPAÑOL

Norma Leticia aprendió a coser desde que tenía 14 años, ya que a esa edad tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia en una maquiladora que estaba cerca de su casa en donde inició como ayudante, además su hermana le enseño a elaborar arreglos de F.. Hace cuatro años tomo la decisión de apoyar su economía familiar, ya que su esposo trabaja en la construcción y no siempre tiene trabajo, por lo mismo sus ingresos son muy variables. Ante esa situación decidió iniciar su negocio en donde combina la fabricación de ropa, con la elaboración de arreglos florales, contando con la ayuda de su esposo.

Hace unos meses, compró una camioneta para facilitar el abasto de sus materias primas y reducir sus costos de transporte, ya que las telas las compra en diferentes tiendas en la ciudad, pero las F. las compra en la ciudad vecina de Saltillo, que esta a una hora de distancia, es por eso que en estos momentos requiere de un crédito por $925 USD a pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses y así poder surtirse de sus materias primas y aprovechar el incremento en la demanda por ropa debido al cambio de temporada y por otro lado, para comprar las F. y aprovechar las próxima Fiesta de Muertos, que es una de las mejores épocas para vender sus F..

loans.use: Raw materials

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Three years ago, Leticia started a small business where she sells Tacos and Hamburgers outside her house. She started the business mainly because her husband works in an eventual position, where the pay is not predictable and consistent. That is why some days they do not earn money and for this reason she decided she needed to support the family economy by working herself. She works at home and at the same time, is able to take care of their teenager sons who need a lot of attention. One of them has a tow in front to her house where she prepares the meals.

More recently, their daily clients have been increasing, and this is why she needs a loan of $925 USD and commits to paying back in a term of 6-12 months. The money will be used to buy tables and chairs and also be able to offer a better service in a more comfortable area in the garage of her house.

ESPAÑOL

Hace tres años que Leticia inició su negocio de venta de Tacos y Hamburguesas afuera de su casa. La razón por la que inició fue debido a que su esposo tiene un trabajo eventual por eso había días en que no percibía ingresos y ante esa situación, decidió apoyar la economía familiar con este negocio, sin tener que salir de su casa y descuidar a sus hijos que son adolescentes y requieren de su atención. Cuenta con un remolque ubicado en el frente de su casa en donde prepara los alimentos al público en general.

En la actualidad sus clientes se han ido incrementando, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de $925 USD a pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses, para comprar mesas y sillas y poder atender a sus clientes en un área más cómoda dentro de la cochera de su casa.

loans.use: To Buy Tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For starting new business of Polythene papers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia Lopez was born in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has been selling car parts and accessories for six years now. Her father taught her all about the business since he ran a similar business for most of his life. When she was 20 years old, Eufemia opened Isa Express and slowly she grew the business to where is stands today. Her father helped her financially by giving her the money to purchase a property which happens to be located next to her cousins. The shop is centrally located and attracts a lot of attention from customers. In fact, Eufemia reports that many people come to her simply because they work at the factory next door. “They search for my services, and I deliver,” she says. Ms. Lopez is asking for this loan to be able to purchase spark plugs, filters, spare electronic parts, and motor oil. Her goal is to be able to repair everything in-house so that the job can get done more quickly for her clients. The attention she gives her customers is personal, and she hopes to receive this loan so that she can afford to pay an employee to work Saturdays, which are the busiest days when it comes to car repair.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy spark plugs, filters, spare electronic parts, and motor oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO increase capital

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar I., born in Pichincha, Ecuador, has been a “guayaco” (a Guayaquilian) for 25 years now. He is married with two children that are in school. He owns a business selling used clothes and doing shoe repair. Oscar was originally a factory worker who did not know how to run such a business, but through the encouragement of a friend, he decided to sell second-hand clothes and exhibit them at his parents’ house. He chose to locate the business there since so many people pass by everyday. His decision paid off because bit-by-bit more customers started walking through the door. Now, Oscar’s business is located along a major thoroughfare, and the all of the locals know him for his low prices and quality work. Mr. I. has taken courses in shoe repair as well. He needs this loan so that he can purchase material for cloths such as cotton, silk, a new sewing machine, and shoe repair products such as buffers and vices.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: purchase material for clothes such as cotton, silk, a new sewing machine, and shoe repair products such as buffers and vices.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married with one child who is eight years old. He used to work in a factory, but they had to liquidate four years ago. Because money was tight and he had mouths to feed, Juan opened up his own business, which has become a local favorite in Guayaquil. In fact, whenever the Mifex team visits Ecuador, Juan (or “Nene” as he likes to be called) serves up the best dishes around.

He and his wife work seven days a week managing their restaurant which sells rice & beans, beef, chicken, and chorizo. His wife Betty is the cook, and Nene attends to the clients. It wasn’t easy starting the restaurant because they didn’t have much capital. However, like many other Ecuadorian businesses, they started out of their home to save money. Through perseverance, things have gone pretty well over the past four years. They have received such high demand that they had to build an extension to their home just to make space for more tables. Not only are customers coming from the local neighborhood, but from all around Guayaquil. Nene and Betty run the restaurant from 6:30 pm until 2:00 am. They are asking for this loan so that they can buy more tables and chairs, as well as prime materials such as rice and cooking oil.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy more tables and chairs, as well as prime materials such as rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy is a 40-year-old married mother of two. She is a very active woman and has been an entrepreneur since she was very young. In fact, Elsy sold clothes through college so she could afford to go to school. When she got married, her father-in-law sold goods in the towns, and he taught her a lot about sales. With over twenty years of experience in this business, Ms. T. has found her niche. Her husband helps her operate the business when he can, but he has his own job in a factory. On his days off, he is responsible for purchasing the clothing material and negotiating the prices with the suppliers. Both Elsy and her husband know the business very well, and they are constantly trying to think of ways to improve it. Their strength has allowed them to grow since first starting. Elsy wants to apply for credit so that she can offer other varieties of products, taking advantage of the frequent celebrations that the town throws. She envisions colorful garments for the party-goers as well as continuing the line of clothes she currently sells.


Mifex offers our clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy yards of cotton and silk material

loans.name: Giannina

texts.en:
Giannina Q. was born in Santa Elena 45 years ago. She runs a small stand selling “fast food,” but not in the American sense of the word. There are hamburgers and hot dogs, but more local specialties such as salchipapas can be found at her “restaurant on wheels.” She works everyday from 4:00 pm until 11:00 pm, and Q. says she learned this business when she was an employee at a bar during college. With six years of experience in this line of work, she has her loyal clients who love her special flavors. Q. is asking for this $850 loan so that she can buy a new cart and open a stationary location.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Quimi is asking for this $850 loan so that she can buy a new cart and open a stationary location.

loans.name: Iralda

texts.en:
Iralda C. was born in Manabi, Ecuador and is 40 years old. She is a married mother of two who sells perfumes, creams, and clothes to her female clients. She attends to the business at her own home and is willing to do business just about any time of day any day of the week. Iralda takes advantage of the fiestas that happen in the town and works along side a friend of hers who also runs a clothing business. Her friend supported her financially when it came time to start Cosmeticos Iralda, and her husband stood behind her every step of the way. With five years of experience, she can’t complain. Business has been pretty good for Iralda. She has been able to supplement her husband’s income with her own. She is asking for this loan to buy new perfumes and cosmetic products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy new perfumes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa P. was born in Bolivar, Ecuador, but she moved to Guayaquil roughly fifteen years ago. She is married with two children, and she sells fresh ice cream to the community via her mobile cart, as well as the various stationary locations she has opened. She started this business because she thought she could be successful. Her husband has worked at an ice cream factory as a distributor for the last several years. Ninfa now earns more than her husband. Working every day of the week, Ms. P. has been successful so far. Located near a major street, “Helados Ninfa” receives a lot of traffic. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy another freezer and to increase production of ice cream.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy another freezer and to increase production of ice cream.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on the capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase Capital

loans.use: To increase Capital

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.use: To increase on Capital

loans.use: To improve on the capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase Stock

loans.name: “Lupita” Claudia Gua

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Lupita has a small grocery store. Her grandmother began this business when Lupita was a little girl, and opened this store selling just candies and crispy tortillas. But only a year later, her grandmother named her manager, and Lupita was the person in charge of the store. This meant that Lupita was the one responsible for the whole family’s expenses. The family members are: Lupita, her little four year old daughter and her grandmother. She is not divorced but has lived separated from her husband for some time now. Lupita manages the business and that includes supplying the store.

She is requesting a loan for $550.00 USD, payable in a term of 6-12 months. She wants to use this amount for supplies in her store, because in this season she has to be able to offer credit to her clients, who are facing a lot of expenses because of the new school period.

ESPAÑOL

La señora Lupita tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, este negocio lo inició su abuelita cuando ella era muy pequeña y solamente vendía dulces y tostadas, pero con el paso del tiempo se lo dejo a su cargo, ya que ella es la que se encarga de los gastos de su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su pequeña hija de 4 años y su Abuelita, pues esta separada de su esposo desde hace algún tiempo. Lupita es la que se encarga de surtir el negocio y de administrarlo.

Está solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de $ 550 USD a pagar en un plazo de 6 – 12 meses, para la compra de mercancía ya que en esta temporada tiene que darle crédito a sus clientes debido a que enfrentan muchos gastos por el regreso a clases de los niños.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
ENGLISH

In 1984 Mr. Juan S. left his town looking for a better life. He moved to Linares City to study in an agricultural school, but when he finished his studies he could not find a job in the area in which he studied. For this reason, he began to work in a furniture store as a collector and salesman, where he learned about the furniture business. Six years ago he started his own small business looking for a better future for his wife and three children. His wife supports him by helping with the organization of his business.

Juan is requesting a loan for $925 USD for the purchase of chairs and tables for the next season. In this upcoming season, their sales of this type of furniture are increased. He wants to pay the loan back in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

En 1984 el señor Juan S. salió de su pueblo buscando una vida mejor y se mudó a Linares a estudiar en una escuela agropecuaria, pero al terminar sus estudios no encontró empleo en el área en que estudió y comenzó a trabajar en una mueblería como cobrador y vendedor de muebles, en donde aprendió el negocio. Hace seis años que inició su negocio buscando poder ofrecer un mejor futuro para su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos. Su esposa además de atender el hogar le ayuda en la organización del negocio.

Juan esta solicitando un préstamo por $925 USD para la compra de sillas y mesas para vender en su negocio ya que piensa aprovechar la próxima temporada en que se incrementan sus ventas por este tipo de muebles. El plazo que solicita para pagar el préstamo es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Chairs and Tables

loans.name: María Adriana

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Four years ago Adriana and her husband began their small business in order to provide a better future to their family because they have three children. In the beginning they only sold second hand cloths and notions. Today the business is rapidly growing and is a notions and stationery store with a great variety of items.

Their business setting is a great location, in a new zone of the city which has been growing fast lately and at the same time the demand of their products has been increased. This is the reason why Adriana is requesting a loan for $200 USD to pay back in a term of 3-6 months to supply a diversity of items.

ESPAÑOL

Hace cuatro años que Adriana y su esposo iniciaron su pequeño negocio vendiendo ropa usada y algunos artículos de mercería con el objetivo de brindar un mejor futuro para sus familia, ya que tienen tres hijos. Con el tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y ha llegado a ser una Mercería y Papelería en donde ofrecen una gran variedad de artículos.

Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado en una zona de la ciudad que ha estado creciendo mucho, es por eso que la demanda por sus productos se ha ido incrementando y debido a ello, Adriana solicita un crédito por $ 200 USD para surtir de mercancía variada su negocio, ella piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Sisney

texts.en:
Sisney G. is a 40-year-old married mother who runs a tailor shop for men and women. With 18 years of experience, Sisney reached the point where she needed her own office space to manage all of the business she was getting. Originally, she learned how to be a seamstress from years of working in a factory, but she opened Costuras de Doña Sydney in her own house. Her helper is her only son, who cuts the molds and measures the material. Ms. G. works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm every day of the week. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase more fabric and thread and set up an exhibit window for her work. Sisney has had to run the business on her own with some help from her son, and she wants lenders to know that she is very entrepreneurial and does not quit.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: purchase more fabric and thread and set up an exhibit window for her work

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter S. is a father of three, and he owns a business, selling all types of goods for the home and library. Since he was very young, he has sold home items, and when he married, he continued to do so with his wife’s help. He decided to work out of the home to help his wife Katy raise their children. With over fifteen years of experience, Walter has become well-known throughout this neighborhood. He has been able to purchase an air conditioner, which is always welcomed by his loyal patrons, and is know for his fair prices. His wish is to find capital to fund the growth of his business and start doing custom orders for his clients. Some of the items that customers demand are home furnishings, cookware, tools, and clothing.


Mifex offers our clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Expand business to on-demand goods such as home furnishings, cookware, tools, and clothing.

loans.name: Lusita

texts.en:
Lusita is 59 years old, and she is a single mother of eight! All of her children have since moved out of the house, but they take with them the many lessons that their mother Lusita taught them.

When she left her parents house many years ago, Lusita dedicated herself to selling goods near the major streets in Guayaquil. In the past she also worked in a restaurant for the Ecuadorian Navy, but when they closed their doors, she moved her business to her home. It hasn’t been easy for Ms. C.. Her husband left her to raise all eight children, so she had to find part time work outside the home to bring in enough income for the family. Lusita wants to raise $585 so that she can purchase more diverse products like briefcases and bags for businesspeople and consumer items like umbrellas and car accessories.


Mifex offers our clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Lusita wants to raise $585 so that she can purchase more diverse products like briefcases and bags for businesspeople and consumer items like umbrellas and car accessories.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret was born 53 years ago. She is married and has children. Margaret is very hard working and this has enabled her to get various ways of educating her children. She is a member of Mothers Union affiliated to Anglican Church of Kenya. This association helps members in solving various problems that affect them and the community they live. Margaret runs a small Retail business in Muhuti, Kangema Kenya. She sells gallons and house hold products. She is currently making a profit of about $71 per month and this is what she survives on. Once she gets this loan, she is planning to be selling in other market centre of Kangema and Kiriaini. This will increase her sales volume and profits too.

loans.use: Margaret would like to build a semi-permanent house for the family

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married; she is 48 years old and has four children. Three of her children have completed high school, whereas the other one is still in Form Three.

Mary has been a member of Gondo Rehab Women group since 2003. She has been using small loans from the group and repaid all the 4 loans she borrowed. These small loans have been assisting her to pay school fees for her children. Mary sells used and new shoes (both men's and women's shoes) in a business she started in 2002.

It has been progressing ever since it was started and it’s the main income generating activity that she has. In one month, she makes an average of about $100 per month and this supports the whole family. But she would like to increase her supply to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: Mary would like to buy a bale of used shoes to be ready for the festive season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary W. was born 45 years ago. She is married and has four children. She is a dedicated member of the Catholic Church. She is a farmer and grows tea, vegetables, beans, maize, coffee and she has dairy cows. Every month she is able to sell her farm produce of about USD125 from sale of milk, vegetables and tea leaves. Her income is not enough to meet all her family needs, therefore, she is would like to take a loan to supplement her current earnings.  She wants to buy chicken and goat manure to increase land productivity. Also she will be able to maintain her animals by buying Dairy feeds to possibly increase milk production. She believes the loan will increase out put and this will lead to improved earnings and later change the standard of living.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy manure, animal feeds and agrochemicals

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. is a married lady with four children, they live in Mbale town.  She deals with drugs such as;  Syrups, tablets, Ointments , injectables. She is capable in this business because she trained as a nurse, she always handles her customers in  a proper way giving expected doses for her patients.  This business has operated for three years from now and its situated in Mbale town at a strategic point.   

She begun her business with capital she collected from her salary, she collected her salary with the vision of opening a drug shop. Her business is doing very well, she has got many customers this makes her turn over high hence good profits.

She is requesting for a loan worth $800, for boosting up her business by improving on her stock,  so that she can make profits which can help her improve on the standard of living of her family,  pay fees for her children, and also help the community on the other hand.

If given that loan money, she will be able to pay back within the period stated.

loans.use: To improve on the stock of drug shop business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old married with three children. She is a dedicated member of Gondo Women Group being the Vice chairperson and a leader in her Anglican Church.

Currently all her children are in high school causing her to strain because of the associated school fees. She pays USD520 per term thus requiring that she secure a loan every year. She had a loan of USD225 and has cleared it, paying it back promptly.

She grows tea leaves, vegetables and she has dairy cows. She has been able to meet the basic needs of her family through the income she gets from her farm. She puts effort in applying manure in her farm and buying the right feeds for her animals to maintain high produce. On average, she gets USD225 per month from selling some of her farm produce.

loans.use: Susan wants to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the pharmacy business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 33 years old, married and has two children. Her family depends on a small piece of land where she grows vegetables and beans. Joan has benefited from the group and WEEC by accessing small loans and this has increased her capacity to look after her family without relying on her husband. She is a dedicated agri-business woman; she applies the business skills she has attained over the years from group trainings to make money from what she produces. The following gives her income: sale of milk, tealeaves and vegetables from her small farm. For some time, she has been selling Napier grass from a rented small piece of land. From her farming, she is able to earn about USD150 monthly but this is not enough to sustain her family. 
Right now she plans to rent a bigger plot of land to plant more Napier grass vegetables for sale. As the business grows, she wants to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Joan is optimistic that she will get a break through and live a happy life.

loans.use: Joan would like to rent a plot of land to grow vegetables and Napier grass for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For boosting up the Tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on her bakery business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is 42 years of age and married with twelve children. Two are independent, one is in college, three in secondary school and four in primary school and the rest are still too young for school. She loves her family and works very hard to provide the basic needs to her children despite so many challenges.

She is among the pioneers of Ngondo Rahab womens group and she has managed to pay back 3 loans already. She sells bananas to the neighboring schools and hospital. Besides this business, she grows vegetables, potatoes and maize on a small piece of land.

Her husband is an office messenger at one of the schools in that village. He is supportive, though his salary is very small. He assists her to look after the planted crops and marketing of the produce. Lucy got a small tender to supply two schools with bananas and this requires more money which she does not have right now. She is getting bananas on credit to clear when she is paid but the prices are inflated because of buying on credit. She believes when she gets the loan, her business will enable her to pay school fees without much struggle.

loans.use: Lucy wants to stock her banana business and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 22 years old; she is married and has two children. One is in primary school and the other is very young. She is an active member of Kagaa Women Group and adheres to the rules and regulations of the group. She sells used clothes and eggs from her small Poultry business which she started in 2004.

From her poultry business, she sells 3 trays of eggs to Ngurueni Market every day. She employs one person who assists her in running her clothes business. She uses her poultry waste as manure on her land and this enriches the soils very much, she has a piece of land where she gets vegetables for the family. Therefore, she does not spend on vegetables.

She wants to buy chickens and buy a bale of first class used clothes. This will increase her returns as well as her income. She is dedicated to her work and believes it will influence other young mothers in her community who think they can’t make it in life.

loans.use: Beatrice wants to buy a bale of used clothes and 50 layers chickens.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old and a single mother of three children. Two are in primary school and the first born has been admitted to a teachers college. She has been very active in the group meetings and has been able to clear previous loans she received from the group.

She is a regular customer because she has borrowed a loan for four rounds and is very diligent about servicing the loans in good time. She is trusted by her group members. Nancy is a hardworking lady and has been able to meet her family needs through farming. She grows tea leaves and Napier grass which are her main source of income. She also grows food for domestic use. Nancy is employed in a local hotel where the earnings she receives have enabled her to rent a plot of land and plant tea to substitute the family income.

With the hope of securing a loan, her son will be able to join the college, thus relieving the burden from her shoulders. She believes that educating her children is an investment. Repaying of the loan in installments will enable her to maintain other activities focused on her family.

loans.use: Nancy wants to pay college fees for her son.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Marisela Gonzáles is a 28 year old woman who lives in San Bartólo Coyotepec, Oaxaca, in the Mexican southeast. This town is famous because there are a lot of specialist artisans working with black clay. According with the town’s tradition, people learn from the time they are children to knead the clay. And when they are grown, they learn different stages of the manufacturing process until the final stage of cofundation in the furnace. She learned this trade in the same way and now she has set up in the artisans market of her town. Eight years ago she formally started her small business by inheritance of her parents, because this is the popular tradition and the community way of living that was passed down to her. Marisela has two children, 2 and 4 years old, and this is the reason she wants to increase her business and get a better standard of living.

She is requesting a loan for $475 USD and hopes to be able to buy crude clay products (i.e. firewood and clay). She is committed to repaying the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Marisela González tiene 28 años y vive en San Bartolo Coyotepec en el estado de Oaxaca, esta comunidad es famosa por tener gente especialista en la elaboración de piezas en barro negro. De acuerdo con la tradición del pueblo, los niños aprenden desde muy pequeños a amasar el barro y conforme van creciendo van aprendiendo las diferentes etapas de la elaboración de las piezas, hasta llegar al cocimiento en el horno como etapa final del proceso. Es así como Marisela aprendió el oficio desde niña y en la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado artesanal del pueblo en donde ofrece sus productos a los turistas que visitan aquélla zona. Hace ocho años que inicio formalmente su negocio por herencia de sus padres ya que es la tradición en la población y es la forma de vida de la comunidad. Marisela tiene dos hijos pequeños de 2 y 4 años y por ellos quiere mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

Esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 475 USD para poder comprar algunos productos de barro crudo, comprar leña de encino y barro. El plazo para pagar que solicita es de 6-12 meses

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en:
Mr. Celedonio sells ice cones, and fruit cocktails, on his tricycle in the summertime. And then in the winter, he sells tamales and hot chocolate. He already has 9 years of experience doing this.

Mr. Celedonio would like to buy another, better, tricycle because he knows the city very well and knows where to go to sell his food. This is why he is thrilled with the idea of buying a second tricycle, and this way he will be able to have help in selling his food. This will increase his sales and income, and he will feel empowered to improve his family conditions.

Mr.Celedonio is asking for a loan of $900.00. He will invest this money in a tricycle and some ingredients.

Español

El Sr. Celedonio vende durante el verano en su triciclo raspados de hielo y ensaladas de fruta. Durante el invierno vende tamales y el chocolate caliente. Él tiene ya 9 años de experiencia en este giro. A El Sr. Celedonio le encantaria comprar otro triciclo porque conoce muy bien la ciudad y sabe donde vender su producto. Esta es la razón por la cual esta emocionado con la idea de comprar un segundo triciclo, y de esta manera él podrá tener ayuda extra en la venta . Esto aumentará sus ventas y su ingreso y con esto mejoraran sus condiciones familiares. El Sr.Celedonio está solicitandoun préstamo de USD$900.00.pagaderos en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses el dinero sera invertido en un triciclo y para la compra de ingredientes. De antemano, gracias por tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy another tricycle and ingrdients

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en:
Mr. Silverio S. Domínguez is a Tailor and he has been dedicated to this activity for more than ten years. He would like to renew his sewing machine becauseit is very obsolete and does not work rapidly enough to keep up with the demand.

He spends time fixing the machine instead of working faster. His business is located at the entrance of two habitational residential places and this is an advantage because it generates a good flow of customers.

His future plans are to grow this business and hire another person, and together make more repairs and new clothes. Mr. Silverio is requesting a loan of $900,00 USD payable in a term of 6 – 12 months. He wants to use this amount for a new sewing machine and buy supplies. This will allow him to make any type of clothing that is requested by his customers, and will increase his production, therefore making a better familiar entrance.

ESPAÑOL

El Sr. Silverio S. Domínguez se adedicado por mas de 10 años a la satreria elaborando ropa y costuras . El quisiera renovar su equipo del trabajo porque sus máquinas son obsoletas y no puede trabajar rápidamente, se pasa el tiempo arreglando las maquinas y en consecuencia no obtiene el ingreso que quiere y necesita.

Su negocio está situado en la entrada de dos complejos habitacionales , ésto es una ventaja porque genera un buen flujo de clientes. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio y contratar a otra persona para que juntos hagan mas prendas de vestir y mas reparaciones de ropa.

El Sr.Silverio está solicitando un préstamo de $900.00 USD de pagaderos en un Plazo de 6 - 12 meses. Él desea utilizar esta cantidad para una máquina de costura nueva y comprar materiales, ésto permitirá que él haga cualquier tipo de trabajo y aumentará su producción y clientes, por lo tanto una major entrada familiar.

loans.use: sewing machine and supplies

loans.name: “Juanita” Juana

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Doña Juana lives in a small town in Oaxaca state, in the Mexican Southeast. She has three sons, two of them born with cleft lip disease and it was the reason for starting her small business in order to pay their medical treatments (and afford their studies) because they've needed operations since they were little children. Four years ago she started her business, where she offers fruits, vegetables and groceries. Actually, her youngest sons are students at school and support her in the small business. In addition, her oldest one supports her by selling goats in the nearby communities into “los días de plaza” (market day) and this is why they share the credit for both businesses.

She is asking for a loan of $550 USD to be able to supply her business, because when her children go back to school, she has a lot of expenses. And now she needs the working capital to help supply her business and buy some goats to sell in different community markets. The term to repay will be 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Doña Juana vive en una comunidad pequeña en el estado de Oaxaca, en el sureste mexicano. Ella tiene tres hijos, los dos menores nacieron con el paladar hendido y es por eso que decidió iniciar su negocio para poder costear los estudios y el tratamiento de sus hijos, ya que fueron operados desde pequeños. Hace cuatro años inició su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras y en la actualidad sus hijos menores estudian y le ayudan en el negocio. Su hijo mas grande le ayuda dedicándose a la compra-venta de ganado en las comunidades cercanas en los días de plaza (mercado del pueblo) y es por eso que comparten el crédito para ambos negocios.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 550 USD para poder surtir mejor su negocio, ya que con el regreso a clases de sus hijos tuvo muchos gastos y necesita apoyo de capital de trabajo para resurtirse y además requieren recursos para comprar algunos chivos para vender en los mercados cercanos. El plazo para pagar será de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: to buy goats and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of drugs in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on farming methods and tools in order to raise the standard of living in the locality.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of produce in the business in order to meet customer demand and raise the standard of living in the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the fish production in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of furniture in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock and to meet the family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the standard of living both at home and in business maintainance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the sale of coffee in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of coffee in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock to meet customers demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the training facilities in the Institution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To imrove on his hard ware stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open up a drug shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Maria de los Angeles is a 54 year old woman. She is a widow and she's enjoyed selling since she was young. She started her small business since 2000, and at the present time, she receives support from her son and her daughter. They live with her because María de los Angeles has cataracts in both eyes and she cannot see very well and so she requires their love and support. She sets up a stand in different local markets and people prefer to visit her because she always has fancy merchandise.

She is requesting a loan for $925 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. She will use this to buy a greater quantity of clothes for a lower cost and she will prepare for the next season when she hopes her sales will increase.

ESPAÑOL

Maria de los Angeles es una mujer de 54 años, viuda, que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a vender diferentes cosas. Ella inició su pequeño negocio a partir del 2000 y en la actualidad le ayuda uno de sus hijos y su nuera que viven con ella, ya que debido a que esta enferma de sus ojos (tiene cataratas en ambos) no puede ver muy bien y requiere de su apoyo. Acostumbra poner su puesto en varios mercados rodantes en zonas muy populares, en donde la gente la prefiere pues siempre trata de tener una variedad de mercancías del gusto popular.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo por $925 USD para comprar ropa en mayor cantidad y a un menor costo y prepararse para la nueva temporada en que se incrementan sus ventas. Piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and notions

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Five years ago, Lorena started her business because she wanted to support her husband and to be self-sufficient in order to offer a better quality of life to her children. She sells clothes in the flea market to fulfill this goal. She never imagines that her business would be their only sustenance as it is today, because her husband has been sick since the beginning of this year and he has been operated on twice (gall bladder). Now he is recovering and this is why Lorena is maintaining her family with the income of her business.

Lorena is asking for a loan for $925 USD to be able to grow her business. This loan is necessary because she has many expenses tp pay off because of her husband's sickness. And this is why she needs the working capital. She is confident she will be able to repay the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Hace cinco años que Lorena inició su negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado rodante debido a que quería apoyar a su esposo y tener su propio ingreso para darle una mejor vida a sus dos pequeños hijos. Nunca imagino que su negocio sería su único sustento como lo es hoy en día, pues su esposo ha estado enfermo desde principio de este año y lo operaron dos veces de la vesícula y esta en recuperación desde hace dos meses, es por eso que Lorena está manteniendo a su familia con los ingresos de su negocio.

Lorena esta necesitando un crédito por $925 USD para poder surtir su negocio, ya que ha tenido muchos gastos por la enfermedad de su esposo y es por eso que necesita capital de trabajo. En caso de verse favorecida por el préstamo piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elba Guadalupe

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Elva is a 29 year old woman. She is married and has two children, and her husband works in a restaurant. Two years ago she started her business, thinking that an additional income would help with the family’s expenses. She started walking house to house offering bedspreads and sheets and later she included shoes too as her clients began requesting it.

In this occasion Elva is asking for a loan by $925 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. She wants to buy bedspreads, sheets and used clothes because she wants to sell her merchandise in the flea market as complement of its business. She wants to see her business grow and then she hopes to buy a car so she could offer her merchandise in neighboring towns.

ESPAÑOL

Elva es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en un restaurante. Hace dos años inició su negocio con la idea de tener un ingreso adicional al de su esposo y ayudar a los gastos de su familia. Fue así como ella sola empezó a vender colchas y sábanas casa por casa, más tarde incluyó también los zapatos pues algunas de sus clientes se lo pedían.

En esta ocasión Elva esta solicitando un préstamo por $925 USD a pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses, para comprar sábanas y colchas y además una paca de ropa usada para ir a vender al mercado rodante como complemento de su negocio. Ella quiere que su negocio crezca y en un futuro poder comprar un carrito para poder ofrecer sus mercancías en los poblados cercanos.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets and clothes

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
K. Moun sells sweets in her local village, and takes care of her growing family. Typically K. Moun sells about $1 worth of sweets each day, and has expenses of about $0.75, which provides her with a daily income of about $0.25. Her son and his wife, and her daughter and her husband all live with K. Moun. All four of them work at a local factory and they each earn a salary of $60 a month.

K. Moun is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase land. Once she is able to repay the loan for the land, K. Moun would like to build a home for her family which she anticipates will be expanding more in the future. She takes pride in being able to care for her children and their families, and looks forward to providing them all with a larger home. Also, the land is an investment which she will be able to pass down to her children in the future.

loans.use: Purchase land

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 30 years old and married with two children. Both children are in primary school. She is an active member of the Catholic Church, and she is among the women leaders of the church.

She lives near the market centre, where she operates a business of knitting and sewing. Her business is unique and it is growing with time. But in the area, water has been a big problem so she ends up using what little income she gets from her business to buy water for her family. The only solution is to secure a loan and buy a tank and she will be able to harvest rain water. Her expenses will be reduced and she will save some money and this will help her to pay school fees for her children. She is willing to repay the loan by installments as agreed.

loans.use: Milka wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old and married with 4 children. All of her children are in primary school. She is an active member of the Catholic Church and a Sunday school teacher in the same church. She specializes in farming. She grows vegetables like tomatoes, kales, spinach godgets and cereals. She sells them in her local market where she earns USD110 monthly.

She has been fetching water from the river to apply and irrigate on her farm and it’s a long distance. Water has been a challenge in her farming so that she has been dreaming of having her own tank or source one day, but due to insufficient income she has never been able to get a tank.

The area has a shortage of water and she believes after getting a tank she will manage to irrigate her garden in dry seasons leading to regular and consistent supply of the vegetables throughout the year. Her income will be sustained thus stabilizing her life.

loans.use: Mercy wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Two of her children are in secondary and the last born is in primary school. She is the secretary in her group and an active member in her local church. She is one of the founding members of the group thus setting a good example to others by adhering to rules and regulations of the group.

Lydia is an excellent tailor and business woman, specializing on school uniforms, lady garments, and textiles. On average, she gets USD140 monthly where she is able to pay for her children's school fees and provide for the basic needs of the family. She is looking forward to securing a loan to buy different types of textile materials for the preparation of festive season.

School uniforms and casual clothes being her main target, she struggles to meet the demand in the local market and she believes that by getting a loan she will manage to satisfy all her customer's needs. She is willing to repay the loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: Lydia wants to buy different types of textile garments.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Two are in primary and the last born is in pre-primary. She is very active in the group being one of the founders, and she demonstrates good record of attendance in the group.

She had an aim of improving her life when she joined the group. She has proven herself right and she has been the pillar to the success of the group, as everyone looks to her for strength. She has also been able to contribute in leadership among women, empowering them and motivating them.

Ann sells used shoes at Ngurueni market and besides this, she grows vegetables and sells cereals for family consumption on her farm. Her business has been doing well despite the fact that she has been experiencing stock outs. By securing a loan, Ann will manage to acquire more stock for her business and she will be on the right track to fulfilling her dream of financial independence.

loans.use: Ann wants to buy more shoes for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 41 years of age and married with 3 children. Two are in high school and the last born is in primary school. She is the assistant chairperson of Ngurueini Ngatha Women group and one of the founding members. She is a church elder, a youth counselor and also a local community developer.

Joyce is a business woman; she sells cereals, cooking oil, sugar, salt, bread, soap and detergents. Her business has been performing well but she finds it hard to meet her family’s basic needs. Monthly, her business generates about USD300 but this is not enough to cater to all her family's needs and to buy a water tank.

She needs the tank to save her from walking a long distance to fetch water and she will be able to harvest rain water. She is hard working and paying the loan in installments will not be a big hassle.

loans.use: Joyce wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years and single with a baby boy schooling at a local primary school. She is the chairlady of Ngurueini Ngatha Women group despite being the youngest. She takes all the responsibilities and mobilizes women to join hands and develop in all spheres of life.

Esther is very involved in the community. She is also a youth secretary in her local church. She owns a salon, which is at the market and also sells vegetables. Most of her clients are church members whom she says respond positively towards her services. She wants to buy more equipment to be able to handle a larger number of customers.

She has a strong belief that she will get clients after purchasing all the equipments needed for a modern salon and this will lead to increased income. Out of the income, she will be able to support her child, repay the loan and pay the group contributions without much hassling. On average, she gets about $130 per month from the two businesses. She sets a good example to other community youths that they can make it in life as long as they have a positive attitude towards life and are willing to work hard.

loans.use: Esther wants to buy 2 blow driers, weaves, braids, hair clips and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 29 years old and married with 3 children. All her children are in public school under the free education program. She is a very active member of her group and she joined the group after seeing how the members were benefitting.

Since she joined, she has adhered to group rules and regulations and she has been paying group contributions timely. She is a nursery school teacher and has a vegetable business which supplements her salary. She pays the school fees for her children with the income she accumulates monthly.

By the end of the month, she is able to get USD100. She has been having a burden of paying school fees for her children and she wonders what will happen after they join high school and the fees only get more expensive. She also wants a loan to pay for her own school fees to join part time college and advance her education for her to get a high paying job. After completion, she is assured of supporting her children and they will get quality education. She believes in investing in education above anything else and she is willing to repay the loan in increments every month.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her college education

loans.name: Shilliakah

texts.en:
Shilliakah is 52 years of age and married with 6 children. Five of her children are self reliant and married. Her last child is in primary school. She is among the oldest member of her group, very active in church and in the community, being in the council of elders.

She practices mixed farming where she has two dairy cows and grows vegetables in her farm. From the dairy cows, she gets 16 litres of dairy milk which is supplied to the community. Vegetables are a bit of a challenge because of the shortage of water in the area of which demand for them is a bit high. She needs the tank to enable her to do irrigation in times of dry seasons.

On average, she is able to get USD160 from milk sales and vegetables monthly. She is ready to repay the loan with installments and she will be grateful should you choose to help fund her business. She will face no more weather limitations after she gets the tank.

loans.use: Shilliakah wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old and married with 3 children. All her kids are in primary school which is free. She is a devoted Christian and a leader in a movement which supports farming in her community. She grows vegetables; kales, cabbages, carrots and rears pigs, goats and chickens.

She manages to get USD120 from the vegetables and animals at the end of the month. She is planning to be irrigating her crops with the water she will harvest and this will multiply her income. The community is in the real need of vegetables but water has been inadequate. She believes she will be a mile ahead when she gets the loan to buy a tank because she will face no weather limitations.

loans.use: Cathrine wants to buy water tank

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Personal Data: Joyce is a young, energetic 27 year old woman and married with 3 kids. She is a Christian and a member of the Christian movement in her local church. She has a tailoring business at the market centre where she specializes in making ladies clothes. The business has been stable but due to change of fashions, she has been lacking money to purchase different types of garments for her customers.

After she acquires the loan, she will be able to meet the demand of her customers which will only help to increase the number of clients. Besides tailoring, she practices sustinence farming which supplements food in the family, reducing the cost of buying. She gets low sales from the farm but in the future she will still focus on farming. She accumulates a net income of USD120 monthly. She believes after the loan, she will make a total cross over in her business.

loans.use: Joyce wants to purchase different varieties of textiles materials

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years of age and married with 5 children. She is an active religious person and a secretary of the Ngurueini women choir. She gets her income from hawking food in the Ngurueini market, to masons at construction sites, and farmers around that area as well.

Her business is quite challenging although taxing. She earns about USD200 monthly after she deducts the expenses. She is planning to increase the amount of maize flour she buys per day because she has so many orders from her clients. She can not supply the food alone to various sites and that’s why she would like to employ another person.

The area is growing very fast and this assures her of getting more customers. She is determined to pay her loan in time and see her business grow.

loans.use: Jane wants to buy a carton of maize flour, 8 packets of porridge sorghum, millet, wheat flour, and employ one staff.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Olga Lidia is a married woman, she is 37 years old and has four children. She started this business, hoping to become self-sufficient and offer a better future to her children. This business is selling and processing of cleaning products. When she started, she only sold cleaning products but at this moment she is also processing them with the support of her suppliers. People from her neighborhood like and prefer her products.

The problem that she faces at this moment is the lack of working capital because she has three children in school. She had to make many payments before they're welcome to return to class. And for this reason she requires a loan by $375 USD to invest in the purchase of raw materials and merchandise. She is asking for a term to pay back in 4-8 months.

ESPAÑOL

Olga Lidia es una mujer casada, tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos, hace cinco años inicio su negocio pensando en contar con ingresos propios y poder brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de productos de limpieza, cuando inició su negocio solamente vendía productos, pero con el tiempo empezó a elaborarlos con el apoyo se sus proveedores, en este momento la gente de su colonia la conoce y acude a comprar sus productos.

El problema que enfrenta en este momento es la falta de capital de trabajo debido a que tiene tres hijos en la escuela y tuvo que realizar muchos gastos extra por el regreso a clases de sus hijos, es por ello que requiere de $375 USD para reinvertir en la compra de materias primas y mercancías, solicita un plazo para pagar de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: raw materials and merchandise

loans.name: Louv

texts.en:
Y. Louv is a happy mother of a large and busy family. She has five daughters and one son who all live at home. Y. Louv currently sells fruit near a school that is close to their home. She earns about $3.75 from this each day. Y. Louv's husband is a security guard and he earns a salary of $50 per month. Their four oldest daughters all work in a local factory and each earn a salary of $90 per month. Their 15 year old daughter and 7 year old son are both still attending school.

This large bustling family is currently facing transportation problems, and therefore Y. Louv is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase two motorbikes which cost $500 each. These motorbikes will allow her daughters to safely get to work each day, as well as allow her husband and other two children to get to work and school. Ultimately, this will also allow the family to eliminate the cost of using motorbike taxis.

In the future Y. Louv would like to expand her fruit sales business near the school to include selling water cane. This is popular with the children in the area, and she believes it will help to increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase two motorbikes.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
C. Va is a loving mother of three children who is excited about the opportunity to provide them with a better life. She currently runs a small business of selling Chinese noodles and coffee. She her current sales total about $2.25 per day with expenses of $1.50 per day, for a net income of about $0.75 per day. C. Va is applying for a loan of $1,000 dollars in order to purchase a bigger shop to sell her noodles and coffee in. This will allow her to make her business more established, and thus provide the opportunity for increased business.

C. Va's two older children also help to support the family income. Her oldest son works in a factory and earns a salary of $120 a month. Her daughter works for a local company and earns a salary of $70 a month. Her youngest son is still attending school. In the future C. Va would like to continue to expand her shop, and she would like to make it a very strong and successful restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase shop to sell Chinese noodles and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve and boost up his butchery business.

loans.name: Ayubu

texts.en:
M. lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children and he keeps layers & broilers in his farm. He needs to expand the number of birds in his flock. The need to increase his number of birds is due to the rise in demand of eggs and broilers used as ifter for the month of Ramadan.

M. also grows vegetables which he sells on wholesale to food vendors and other retailers. He uses bird droppings as manure to grow the vegetables. M. is in need of USD 400 to execute his plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
N. is married with four children. He lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He owns a small shop in Tandika market where he sells new imported clothes.

He is planning to add a shoes line, along with selling clothes. His capital is not sufficient to cover this new business line. He is in need of USD 400 to facilitate his plan.

loans.use: Working Capita

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with one child. She lives in Tandika area in Dar es Salaam. Halima owns a food shop near her residence where she sells maize flour, rice beans, cassava flour and other cereals.

Demand for these items has risen sharply following the Holy month of Ramadan. She needs to increase the stock for these items to meet the risen demand. She is in need of USD 400 and commits to repaying the loan in 3-6 months.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili lives in Yombo area in Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children and sells non-alcoholic beverages. She has realized a significant increase in demand for these items due to the Holy month of Ramadan.

She has rented a stall where she is currently running her business. She is planning to rent another place (new outlet) to increase sales. She is in need of extra stock which she cannot accommodate herself. To make her plan work she is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children and she sells maize flour to food vendors. She prepares the flour by herself and she buys the maize in retail, sends it to the milling machine and packs the product in packets of 5-10 kilogrammes.

She also sells by-product as animal feed. She is planning to increase her stock of maize as she is often faced with stockouts. To meet her planned target she is need of USD 400.

loans.use: Wprking Capital

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima lives in Makangarawe area in Dar es Salaam. Salima owns a charcoal store near her residence and she is frequently faced with stockouts.

She needs to increase the size & quality of the stock to smoothly run her charcoal business. Her own savings constitute 20% of her total expansion requirements. She needs a working capital boost of USD 400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Two are in Primary school and the other two are in Secondary school.

Zainabu owns a small stall at Tandika market, which is a famous market in Dar es Salaam. Her business is selling used clothes. She sells used clothes for both men and women. Zainabu is planning to increase the size of her stall and stock many more clothes.

This plan will help her get extra income to pay for school fees for her two children in secondary school. She is in need of USD 400 to execute her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
K. Thon would like to provide her family with a safe and comfortable place to live. Right now the home for her family of five is small and in poor condition. She is requesting a loan of $500 in order to make repairs and improve their home. 

K. Thon works hard as a tailor and typically earns about $1.25 per day. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver, and he earns about $3 dollars a day. Her oldest daughter also contributes to the family income through her work at a local factory. She earns a salary of $80 per month from the factory. K. Thon's younger son and daughter are both currently attending school. K. Thon is eager to make these improvements on their home, and feels that she will be able to better care for her family as a result of this loan.

loans.use: Repair and improve home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of the business in order to meet his family and customers demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of her shop in order to meet customer demand and all family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of kiosk business.

loans.name: “Cheli” Araceli

texts.en:
ENGLISH

14 year ago Araceli and her husband decided to move to Monterrey, looking for a better life for their children. They lived in Chiapas (Mexican Southeast) but they wanted a different environment where their children could grow safely. Cheli’s personality is very friendly, and she started the business of selling shoes by catalogue and products of beauty with its friends. In this way she may handle its schedule and could have additional income for its family, but without neglecting their children who will remain their priority.

Cheli requires working capital to be able to give credit to their clients who spent so much money with the scholastic season. This is why she needs a loan by $825 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Hace 14 años que Araceli y su esposo decidieron mudarse a Monterrey en busca de una mejor vida para sus hijos, ellos vivían en Chiapas pero querían otro ambiente en donde se desarrollaran sus tres hijos. La personalidad de Cheli le ayuda para relacionarse con la gente y aprovechando esta característica, ella inicio el negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo y productos de belleza con sus amistades desde que se mudó a esta ciudad, de esta manera manejaba su horario y podía tener ingresos adicionales para su familia, pero sin descuidar a sus hijos los cuales han sido su prioridad.

Cheli requiere de capital de trabajo para poder darle crédito a sus clientes quienes quedaron muy gastadas después del inicio de la temporada escolar, es por eso que requiere de un crédito por $ 825 USD para pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
After successfully paying back her first loan on time, Carmen R. would like to step up to the next level and apply for a second loan.
