The story of this widowed mother is a testament to the power of microcredit, and Mifex thanks her for her continued efforts. Not only has she built economic value for her family but Carmen has given a sense of pride and motivation to them as well. As the head of the household, Ms. R. constantly works to feed her children and continue running the business. With the increased profits she realized from her first loan, she was able to buy a rotisserie oven for chicken, allowing her to manage the time better. In the morning Carmen purchases and prepares the food, and in the afternoon she can focus on selling it in her newly refurbished market and even doing deliveries. Carmen also makes tasty food called “chifles,” which are fried plantains. She makes these especially for the high school and college students who love to eat at her restaurant/market.

Carmen has been able hire a few hired hands to sell her products, helping to distribute the “chifles” to people around the busy market areas. Ms. R. lives in a marginalized sector of Guayaquil, Ecuador with her three children. Her goal over the past six months has been to attract new clients to her store, and Mifex has seen firsthand the change even in that period of time. With more than 13 years experience in this particular line of business, Carmen is a veteran, and her continued involvement in the Kiva microcredit program has brought more growth than ever before. She hopes continued access to credit will help to pay for food, clothing, medicine, and education for her family. Her second loan will go toward buying display cases and other marketing materials to promote the products which have gained somewhat of brand loyalty of her side of town.

loans.use: Purchase display case, more inventory, and other marketing materials.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio P. is a tailor from Guayaquil, Ecuador. After successfully paying back his first loan, his is asking for a second loan in order to keep growing his business at the rate he has been going the past six months. With his first loan, Melecio bought essential goods like thread, fabric, and a glass case to exhibit his work.

Mr. P.’s wife acts as his right-hand and helps sew, conduct sales, and purchase wholesale products for custom orders. He was also able to repair one of his sewing machines, which is now used by his wife, who is a seamstress, to help him make suits for his clients. With his increased income, he was able to pay for his son to take a computer course at the Mifex MERIT Center. In fact, his son is putting his new skills to use by offering services to the community, such as typing documents and other computer-related work on a new computer that was installed in his father's shop. He repaid his loan on time, and is now in need of a new loan in order to keep his business growing the way it has been for the past six months. He plans to increase his inventory and stock up on new fabrics like cotton and wool as well zippers, buttons, and measuring tools to satisfy requests from his clientele.

With over 20 years experience making suits, Melecio has come to understand what it takes to be successful. He believes with this extended access to credit, he can continue to provide a better life for his six children, who also help run the tailor shop when they have free time.

loans.use: He plans to increase his inventory and stock up on new fabrics like cotton and wool as well zippers, buttons, and measuring tools to satisfy custom requests from his clientele.

loans.name: Isaías

texts.en:
Isais owns a small store on a corner of a local street in his neighborhood. He has successfully paid back his first loan through Kiva, and now he would like to step his loan size up to the next level. He is asking for a second loan so that he can buy more items in bulk and pay in cash, which will allow him to receive discounts and charge lower rates to the end consumer. Isais has over twenty years experience in this business, and loves to make Ecuadorian food for his clients like “salchipapas.” Thanks to the efforts he and his wife have put into the business, they have grown steadily. They started out initially by selling a couple cases of cooking oil and one large bag of rice out of their home. Since then, they have moved the shop into a separate location and they feel more confident than ever that their children will be able to attend better schools. They are seeking this second loan in order to keep diversifying their supply and buying essential products in bulk.

As soon as Isais received the first loan he took advantage of the liquidity to buy products in bulk. This had a domino effect on his business. He was able to lower the prices of his products and increase his client base. Isais soon began to purchase many more different products for his clients. He was able to take advantage of spikes in demand due to holidays such as mother's day. He and his family now have a much higher sense of financial security and understand the benefits of credit. They are very thankful for the loan they received and hope they will be able to take advantage of any future opportunities Mifex and Kiva offer.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: They are seeking this second loan in order to keep diversifying their supply and buying essential products in bulk.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz paid off her first Kiva loan on time, and she has plans for growing her business even more. The growth she has experience over the last six months has been amazing. By giving her access to credit, Mifex and Kiva gave Ms. Q. the ability to explore new product lines and take advantage of the niche market for party supplies like piñatas y sorpresas . With a different fiesta just about every two weeks in Ecuador, Luz has positioned herself as one of the best ‘mom and pop’ shops in Guayaquil. Geographically, Luz is lucky to be where she is along major thoroughfares in the marginal part of the city. She has over 25 years of experience and originally began her business with $10 selling toys to children. Realizing that she only had gift items and toys for Christmas, she soon began to purchase inventory for other holidays and parties. Her children help lend a hand in running the business, and they all report a better standard of living from six months ago. With the increased income, Luz has been able to afford more food for the family as well as more working capital to invest back into her shop. Now that she no longer has to rely on the chulqueros who charge 20% monthly, Luz is asking Mifex and Kiva for a second loan so she can purchase more supply in cash and take advantage of the rebates and discounts being offered.

Doña Luz is glad that there is organization like Kiva using technology to help the poor in Guayaquil, Ecuador, for in the past, she had no other option but the loan sharks. Not only did she repay her loan on time, but she is now in need of another loan from Mifex and Kiva. She explains that another loan would be a boon for her company, for she would be able to invest more in wholesale products, introducing new product lines, and increasing her income. In addition to managing her business, Doña Luz manages her home and pays for her childrens' schooling.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fiesta items like piñatas, surprises, and decorations in bulk

loans.name: Luis Oswaldo

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Mr. Luis Oswaldo is married and has two children, he worked as a shoemaker's assistant when he was young and through this, he learned the art of making shoes. 15 years ago, he started his own business with the support of his wife in order to improve their situation economically and he has been teaching his children the art of being a shoemaker as well. Nowadays, his business has grown and their children support he and his wife too. Luis’s business is a typical familiar business and appreciated by the community.

At the moment, Don Luis is preparing for the Christmas Time because in that season the demand increases. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $200 USD to buy raw materials for the manufacture of shoes. The term to pay back will be of 2-4 months.

ESPAÑOL

El señor Luis Oswaldo esta casado y tiene dos hijos, en su juventud trabajo como ayudante de zapatero y poco a poco aprendió el oficio de fabricar zapatos, con la ayuda de su esposa y con el fin de mejorar económicamente su situación inició su negocio hace 15 años y fue enseñando a sus hijos el oficio de zapatero. Hoy en día su negocio ha crecido y sus dos hijos le ayudan en el negocio, además de su esposa, es por eso que se trata de un negocio completamente familiar.

En estos momentos Don Luis esta preparándose para la temporada de ventas navideñas, ya que en esa temporada se incrementa la demanda por los zapatos que fabrica, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por $ 200 USD para comprar materias primas para la fabricación de zapatos, el plazo para pagar será de 2-4 meses.

loans.use: buy raw materials

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Mrs. Martina is a enthusiastic woman who distinguishes herself as being very dynamic. She lives with a couple and has two children who help her in her business. Six years ago, she decided to start her small business, selling in her house buttons, zippers, lace, etc. and with her husband’s support she built a small place in the front of her house, where she has a notions and gifts store.

She wants to be preparing for the next Christmas time, because people like to make hand crafts and her sales increase. This is why she is requesting a loan by $925 USD to buy merchandise and be able to supply to her clients. She wants to repay in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

La Señora Martina es una mujer muy entusiasta que se distingue por ser muy dinámica, ella vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que le ayudan en el negocio. Hace seis años decidió iniciar su pequeño negocio vendiendo en su casa botones, cierres, encajes, etc. y con la ayuda de su cónyuge logró construir un pequeño local a la entrada de su casa en donde tiene una mercería y regalos.

Ella quiere prepararse para la temporada navideña que se avecina, ya que la gente acostumbra elaborar manualidades y se incrementan sus ventas, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 925 USD para comprar mercancía y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, el plazo que solicita es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Deisy Maria Imelda

texts.en:
ENGLISH

A long time ago, Mrs. Deisy took a sewing course because she wanted to learn the art of seamstress and she noticed that she liked it quite a bit. This is why 35 years ago she decided to work by herself, starting with her limited savings and making clothes for her friends in order to contribute to the familiar income. She is married and has three children.

Deisy is requesting a loan by $475 USD so she can buy fabrics and be able to make clothes to offer in the next Christmas season. She is asking to pay back in a term of 3-6 months.

ESPAÑOL

Hace muchos años la Sra. Deisy tomo un curso de costura y confección de ropa para aprender el oficio de costurera y vio que le gustó la actividad, por lo que hace 35 años se decidió a trabajar por su cuenta iniciando con sus ahorros y haciendo trabajos para sus amistades, con el objeto de contribuir al ingreso familiar. Ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos, pero trabaja sola en su negocio.

Deisy esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 475 USD para comprar telas y estar en posibilidades de poder fabricar ropa que piensa vender en la próxima temporada navideña, el plazo que solicita para pagar es de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Yessenia Maria

texts.en:
My name is Yessenia and I sell products for daily consumption, my business is located in the city of Danli, and is frequented often because I tend to my customers personally and I give them fair prices for quality products. My business has generated an income that helps with the family expenses and my goal is to expand my home and my business.

Loan Use: Purchase of bread, milk, coffee, sugar, sodas, eggs, confectionaries and other items.

Mi nombre es Yessenia me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular familiar, tengo mi negocio ubicado en la ciudad de Danli el que es bastante visitado ya que atiendo a mis clientes personalmente y les brindo buenos precios y buen producto. Mi negocio me genera ganancias para poder atender las necesidades de mi familia y mi meta es lograr ampliar mi casa y mi negocio.

loans.use: Compra de pan, leche, cafe, azucar, refrescos, huevos, confites y otros.

loans.name: Carmen Lizeth

texts.en:
I cook and sell tortillas, as I have for several years. I am a single mother, I have two children who help me sell tortillas in our community. I also sell cheese, quesillo(a white traditional Latin American cheese), and butter. My earnings cover family expenses and feeding and schooling my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of corn, lime, firewood, water.

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace algunos años, soy madre soltera tengo 2 hijos que me ayudan a vender las tortillas en nuestra comunidad, vendo tambien queso, quesillo, mantequilla y me genera un ingreso extra para poder cubrir los gastos de mis hijos en sus estudios y alimentacion.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, cal, leña, agua.

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.en:
My name is Edwin, I sell pillows, T-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing. I have had my business for 3 years, and it is visited by loyal clientel because I have fair prices. My business generates an income that covers family expenses. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to sell a higher variety of clothes and the profits I make I will use to build a house, because we are currently renting.

Loan Use: Purchase blouses, T-shirts, pillows, clothing hooks, pocketbooks.

Mi nombre es Edwin, me dedico a la venta almohadas, camisetas, camisas, y ropa de niño, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años, el que es visitados por clientes fijos que tengo ya que les brindo buenos precios, mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia. mi meta es incrementar el inventario y poder vender ropa variada y con las ganancias que obtenga construir mi casa, ya que actualmente alquilamos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, camisetas, almohadas, ganchos de ropa, bolsas.

loans.name: Iris Yovanis

texts.en:
My name is Iris S. and I sell hats, shirts, T-shirts for men as well as skirts, slips, cosmetics and children's clothes. I have had my business for 9 years and I have many loyal customers who enjoy my fair prices and good quality of my products. My business helps to generate an income that covers family expenses and the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase shirts, T-shirts, hats, skirts, slips, clotheshooks, pocketbooks and bags.

Mi nombre es Iris S., me dedico a la venta de gorras, camisas y camisetas para hombres, fajas, faldas, cosmeticos y ropa de niño. tengo mi negocio desde hace 9 años, y es visitado por clientes fijos que tengo, ya que brindo buenos precios y calidad en el producto, mi negocio me genera ganancias para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, camisetas, gorras, faldas, fajas, ganchos de ropa, bolsas

loans.name: Bessy Maribel

texts.en:
My name is Bessy Z., I sell women's underwear, shoes, blouses, T-shirts, combs, wallets, cosmetics, and dresses for girls. I have had my business for 6 years and it is located in the city of Danli. I have the help of my husband to tend to the business. I have a various loyal customers, who are in search of the quality of my products. My business supports my family and also the studies of my children. My goal is to be able to increase sales and to have more of an assortment of products. With the profits I would be able to support my family and fincance the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase women's underwear, shoes, blouses, T-shirts, combs, wallets, cosmetics, girl's dresses, hairpins and pocketbooks.

Mi nombre es Bessy Z., mi negocio se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama, zapatos, camisas, camisetas, blusas, peines, carteras, cosmeticos, vestidos para niña, tengo mi negocio desde hace 6 años y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para atender el negocio. tengo varios clientes fijos, ya que los clientes buscan calidad en los productos. mi negocio me genera el sustento de familia y tambien con los estudios de mis hijos. mi meta es incrementar el inventario y poder vender mas productos surtidos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia y un mejor estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de interior de dama, zapatos, camisas, camisetas, blusas, peines, carteras, cosmeticos, vestidos de niña, ganchos y bolsas

loans.name: Lesly Judith

texts.en:
My name is Lesly M., I repair watches, sell batteries, bracelets, glass, repair glasses and sell enchape-red ceramic jewlery. My business is located in the city of Danli and I have had it for 5 years. This business was run by my husband, but he has passed away. I have a variety of loyal customers, which enable me to earn enought to support my family and to support my son's studies.

Loan Use: Purchase clocks, batteries, bracelets, glass, screws, pigment and enchape-red ceramic jewlery.

Mi nombre es Lesly M., me dedico a la reparacion de relojes, venta de baterias, brazaletes, vidrios, pines, reparacion de anteojos y venta de enchape de joyeria. mi negocio esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli y tengo 5 años de tenerlo. Este negocio era administrado por mi esposo pero lamentablemente el murio. Tengo una variedad de clientes fijos, esto me genera ingresos para sustentar a mi familia y al estudio de mis hijos. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder tener mi propio local.

loans.use: Compra de relojes, baterias, brazaletes, pines, vidrios, tornillos, pegamento y joyeria de enchape

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
My name is Graciela B. B., and I am a barber who cuts hair for men, women and children. I have had my business for 4 years, I have many clients who prefer my haricut styles. My business generates an income that supports my family and the studies of my 4 children, who all help me to clean my store. My earnings I would obtain would help me to improve my store, to support my family and provide a better education for my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of electric machines to cut hair, scissors, combs, brushes, talc powders, gels, creams, oils, water, bags and mirrors.

Mi nombre es Graciela B. B., me dedico al corte de pelo para caballeros, niños y damas, tengo mi negocio desde hace 4 años, cuento con mucha clientela ya que les gustan los cortes de pelo que les hago, mi negocio me genera ingresos para sustentar mi familia y el estudio de mis 4 hijos, los cuales me ayudan a la limpieza de mi local. mi meta es incrementar mis herramientas de trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio, los ingresos que obtenga seran para mejorar el local, para el sustento de mi familia y una mejor educacion de mis 4 hijos.

loans.use: Compra de maquinas electricas de cortar pelo, tijeras, peines, cepillos, talcos, gel, crema, aceite, agua, fijador, bolsas, espejos.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.en:
My name is Maria de la Cruz G., I cook and sell breakfast, lunches and snacks which include, burritos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, tacos, baleadas-honduran tacos, nacatamales-honduran specialty, and I have been doing this for 4 years, my business attracts a large variety of clientel who like how my food tastes. My business generates earnings to support my family and my children. My goal is to increase my production and to increase sales which will generate more profits that will enable me to remodel my business and to cover family expenses, especially the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of beef, chicken and pork, rice, beans, vegetables, tortillas, dough, fish, cheese, butter, eggs, water,disposable plates, cups and spoons, churros, sodas, coffee, sweet bread, oil, tomatoe sauce, lard, margarine, confectionaries and juices.

Mi nombre es Maria de la Cruz G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas entre ellas burritas, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, tacos, baleadas, nacatamales, actividad la cual tengo de realizar por 4 años, mi negocio tiene una gran variedad de clientes ya que esta localizado en un lugar muy transitado por personas y a mis clientes les gusta el sabor de la comida que produzco. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener mi familia y mis hijos. Mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y asi poder vender mas comida a mis clientes, esto me generara ganancias para poder remodelar mi negocio y cubrir los gastos familiares y especialmente el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de carne de res, pollo y cerdo, arroz, frijoles, vegetales, tortillas, masa, pescado, quesillo, queso, mantequilla, huevos, agua, platos vasos tenedores y cucharas desechables, churros, refrescos, cafe, pan dulce, aceite, salsa de tomate, manteca, margarina, confites, jugos.

loans.name: Melissa Gabriela

texts.en:
My name is Melissa D., I have sold tortillas for 5 years. The distribution of the product is mostly to those around my home, though I have a loyal, daily clientel and my children help me to sell my tortillas. My business creates earnings enough to cover family expenses and the education of my children. My goal is to increase my inventory of cornflour, in order to increase production and with the earnings, improve the ovens where I make the tortillas and also to support my family and the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of cornflour, water, firewood, lights, gas, lime.

Mi nombre es Melissa D., me dedico a la produccion y venta de Tortillas, actividad que hago hace 5 años, la distribucion de mi producto es a los alrededores de mi domicilio, asi que tengo una clientela fija diariamente, y mis hijos me ayudan a la distribucion de mi producto. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos. Mi meta es poder obtener mayor inventario de sacos de harina de maiz, para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mejorar las instalaciones donde fabrico las tortillas, asi mismo el sustento de mi familia y los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, agua, leña, fosforos, gas, cal

loans.name: Evelyn Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Evelyn O., I have made and sold tortillas for 4 years and my clientel are loyal, they are my neighbors and people with orders of more than 100 tortillas, which my children help to pack and distribute. The earnings help cover family expenses. My goal is to increase production and by which increase profits to use for the education of my children and to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase cornflour, water, lime, firewood, lights.

Mi nombre es Evelyn O., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que hago hace 4 años y mi clientela es muy buena, son mis vecinos y personas que hacen encargos por cantidades mayores de 100 tortillas. en mi negocio me ayudan mis hijos a empacar y repartir el producto, los ingresos que me genera son para cubrir gastos de nuestra familia. Mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y asi obtener una mayor ganancia la cual la utilizaria para la educacion de mis hijos y sustentar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, agua, cal, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Alba Sobeyda

texts.en:
My name is Alba R., I sell men's and women's clothing ( T-shirts, shirts, blouses, skirts) and stuffed animals. I have had my business for 3 years, and I have many customers who enjoy the quality of my products. My business generates an income which allow me to support my children. My goal is to expand my inventory and to have a larger selection of items. With the profits I would improve my shop/store, support my children and their education.

Loan Use: Purchase men's and women's clothing, stuffed animals, bags.

Mi nombre es Alba R., me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero (camisetas, camisas, blusas, faldas) y peluches, actividad que hago hace 3 años, cuento con mucha clientela ya que les gusta la calidad del producto. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mis hijos. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y poder tener mayor surtido de producto. y con las ganancias poder mejorar el local, sustentar a mis hijos y el estudio de ellos.

loans.use: Compra de ropa para caballero y dama, peluches, bolsas

loans.name: Sayda Azucena

texts.en:
My name ia Sayda S., I produce and sell cakes, frozen treats, chocolate-bananas, cones and ice cream. I have had my business for 5 years. I have loyal customers, most who are my neighbors. I also have the help of my daughters to sell my products. My business creates an income which supports my family and the education of my daughters. My goal is to expand my inventory and with the profits, expand my business, buy more freezers, and continue to support my family and the education of my daughters.

Loan Use: Purchase fruits, sticks, chocolate, bags, sugar, ice cream, cones, iron and plastic cups.

Mi nombre es Sayda S., me dedico a la produccion y venta de charamuscas, paletas, chocobananos, conos, ice cream, tengo mi negocio desde hace 5 años, tengo clientes fijos ya que son mis vecinos, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para la venta del producto. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia y el estudio de mis hijas. Mi meta es poder incrementar mi enventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder ampliar mi negocio y comprar mas frezers y sustentar mi familia y el estudios de mis hijas.

loans.use: Compra de frutas, paletas, chocolate, bolsas, azucar, ice cream, conos, vasos de hierro y plastico, agua

loans.name: Yolanda Siobany

texts.en:
My name is Yolanda M., I produce and sell food and snacks, ( breakfast, lunch, burritos, tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, bread with beans, natural juices, coffe with bread, baleadas-Honduran taco). My son helps me tend to the business. The customers are plenty because I am located in an area of heavy transit. My business generates earnings to feed my family and to cover family expenses. My goal is to expand my inventory to increase production, and with the profits, improve my business and to support my family as well as the education of my son.

Loan Use: Purchase pork, chicken, fish, tortillas, vegetables, cheese, quesillo(traditional white Latin American cheese), milk, sodas, juices, coffee, sweet bread, confections, fruits, tomatoe sauce, butter, oil, spices.

Mi nombre es Yolanda M., me dedico a la produccion y venta de comida y golosinas, (desayunos, almuerzos, burritas, tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, jugos naturales, cafe con pan, baleadas) tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion del negocio, la clientela es buena ya que el local esta en un lugar bastante transitado. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para la alimentacion y cubrir los gastos familiares. Mi meta es poder incrementar el inventario, para tener una mayor produccion y venta de mis productos y con las ganancias mejorar mi negocio, sustentar a mi familia y el estudio de mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de carne de cerdo, pollo y pescado, tortillas, vegetales, queso, quesillos, leche, refrescos, jugos, cafe, pan dulce, confites, frutas, salsa de tomate, manteca, aceite, especias.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is Maria C., and I cook and sell food (fried fish, carne asada, fried chicken, breakfasts, lunches, bread with beans, baleadas-honduran tacos, tortillas with cheese, burritos). I have had my business for 5 years, and I have the help of my husband to tend to the clients. My business has generated earnings to cover the expenses and nourishment of my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to sell more food to my clients and with the earnings, I can improve the bedrooms and finance the studies of my children.

Loan Use:Purchase pork, beef and chicken, fish, beans, butter, margarine, lard, oil, salt, spices, vegetables, fruits, white and sweet breads, coffee, sodas, tortillas, cheese, tomatoe sauce, salsa, juices.

Mi nombre es Maria C., me decico a la produccion y venta de comida (pescado frito, carne asada, pollo frito, desayunos, almuerzos, panes con frijoles, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, burras), tengo mi negocio desde hace 5 años, el cual recibo la ayuda de mi esposo para la atencion y el cobro a los clientes. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos y alimentacion de mi familia. Mi meta es incrementar el inventario para poder vender mas comida a los clientes y con las ganancias poder mejorar las instalaciones y los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de carne de cerdo, res y pollo, pescado, frijoles, mantequilla, margarina, manteca, aceite, sal, especias, vegetales, frutas, pan blanco y dulce, cafe, refrescos, tortillas, queso, quesillo, salsa de tomate, salsinas, refrescos, jugos

payments.comment: Gracias al prestamo que me otorgaron pude incrementar mis ventas, ahora necesito capital fresco para continuar creciendo, gracias por su ayuda.

loans.name: Nery Liduvina

texts.en:
My name is Nery H., and I produce and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 5 years, and I have the help of my daughters to sell them. I have loyal customers, who are mostly people in my neighborhood. My business generates an income that supports my family. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, I can remodel my home( business) and give a better education to my daughters.

Loan Use: Purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, lights.

Mi nombre es Nery H., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, en el cual tengo el apoyo de mis hijas que me ayudan a venderlas, tengo mis clientes fijos, ya que son los vecinos de mi colonia, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder vender mas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa (negocio) y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijas.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, sal, agua, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
My name is Luz M., I sell products of daily consumption. My business is located in the town Tegucigalpa, and is frequented often because of my fair prices. I have the help of my husband when he returns from work. My business generates an income that helps with the needs of the family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, I would invest in the improvement of my home(buiness) and also to support the studies of my son.

Loan Use: Purchase of churros, sodas, juices, instant soups, spices, salt, oil, lard, potatoe, white and sweet bread, fresh milk and powdered milk, coffee, sweets, cookies, light(bulbs).

Mi nombre es Luz M., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio ubicado en la ciudad de tegucigalpa el que es bastante visitado ya que doy buenos precios, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo cuando el regresa de su trabajo. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder atender las necesidades de mi familia. Mi meta es incrementar el inventario para poder vender mas y las ganancias que obtenga invertirlas en la mejora de mi casa (negocio) y tambien poder darle estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de churros, refrescos, jugos, sopas instantaneas, especias, sal, aceite, manteca, papas, pan blanco y dulce, leche en bolsa y leche en polvo, cafe, pastillas, galletas, focos,

loans.name: Agusto Cesar

texts.en:
My name is Agusto F., my job is fixing and painting cars. I have had my business for 5 years. I have the help of my son to complete reparations and I have many good clients. My business generates an income to cover the costs of the shop and family expenses, my goal is to be able to increase my clientel and with the earnings, I can remodel my shop and buy tools, which will all help support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase materials and tools for painting automobiles.

Mi nombre es Agusto F., me dedico al enderezado y pintado de automoviles, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, y tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para realizar los trabajos de enderezado, tengo muy buenos clientes. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos del taller y los de mi familia y mi meta es poder incrementar mis clientes y con la ganancia poder remodelar mi negocio y comprar herramientas de trabajo asi mismo con el sustento de mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de Materiales y herramientas de pintura automotriz

loans.name: Maura Melissa

texts.en:
My name is Maura F., I sell socks, girls' shirts, shirts for adults, blouses, brasieres and hairpins. I have had my business for 3 years, I have numerous customers because I sell in offices and office buildings. My business has given me earnings to support my family and to feed my family. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, remodel my home and give a quality education to my daughter.

Loan Use: Purchase hairpins, socks, shirts, blouses, brasieres.

Mi nombre es Maura F., me dedico a la venta de calcetines, camisas para niña, camisetas, blusas, brasieres, ganchos para pelo, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que vendo en oficinas, edificios de trabajo. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para sustentar mi hogar y la alimentacion de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para vender mas y con las ganancias poder remodelar mi casa y darle un buen estudio a mi pequeña hija.

loans.use: Compra de ganchos de pelo, calcetines, camisetas, blusas, brasieres

loans.name: Delma Aracely

texts.en:
My name is Delma S. and I make slipcovers for car seats, which I have been doing for 3 years, my clientel is very good because many people use slipcovers to protect their seats. My business allows me to generate enough to cover household expenses and my goal is to be able to sell more and with the earnings, buy myself another sewing machine and to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase of fabric, thread and plastics.

Mi nombre es Delma S., me dedico a producir cobertores para asientos de carros, actividad que hago en mi negocio desde hace 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena porque bastante gente les instala cobertores a los carros para proteger los asientos, mi negocio me genera para cubrir los gastos de mi casa, mi meta es lograr vender mas, y con las ganacias poder comprarme otra maquina de costurar y sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de tela, hilo, plastico

loans.name: Santos Tomasa

texts.en:
My name is Santos R. and I sell mangos. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in the neighborhood "los pinos" in Tegucipalga. I have good customers and my business is situated in from of a public school. My business generates an income that supports my family; my goal is to increase sales in order to improve my shop/stand and especially to help with the education of my children.

Mi nombre es Santos R., me dedico a la venta de mangos, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años y esta ubicado en la colonia los pinos de tegucigalpa, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi negocio esta ubicado enfrente de una escuela publica, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mis ventas y asi poder acondionar mejor el lugar de la venta de mangos y especialmente el estudio de mis hijos

loans.use: Compra de mangos, sal, pimienta, chile, bolsas, cuchillos, agua

loans.name: Nancy Yamileth

texts.en: Mi nombre es Nancy G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio desde hace 5 años, mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa de habitacion, y mi clientela son mis vecinos y gente que me encarga mas de 100 tortillas para alguna fiesta o celebracion de cumpleaños, mi negocio me genera ingresos para la alimentacion de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de harina de maiz para poder producir mayores cantidades de tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa (negocio), mantener a mi familia y lo mas importante el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

loans.name: Liliam Elsa

texts.en:
My name is Lilliam C., my job is making and selling snacks ( baleadas-Honduran taco, tortillas with cheese, bread with beans, burritos, enchiladas, cakes). I have had my business for 3 years and my daughters help me to cook and to sell the food. My business is located in my own home and with my earnings I am able to support my family. My goal is to be able to increase my sales, and with the profits I make, to remodel my home and to allow my daughters to study.

Loan Use: Purchase of oil, lard, salt, tortillas, beans, sodas, fruits, sugar, vegetables, cheese, tomatoe sauce, water, butter, white bread, chorizos-sausages.

Mi nombre es Liliam C., me dedico a la produccion y venta de golosinas (baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, burritas, enchiladas, pastelitos) tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años, mis hijas me ayudan a cocinar la comida y venderla, mi negocio esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion y me genera ingresos para poder sustentar mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darles estudio a mis hijas.

loans.use: Compra de aceite, manteca, sal, tortillas, frijoles, refrescos, frutas, azucar, verduras, queso, quesillo, salsa de tomate, agua, mantequilla, pan blanco, chorizos

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
My name is Marta T. and I sell new clothing for men and women, in my business I sell pants, blouses, T-shirts, skirts, socks and children's clothing also. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in my home. My husband helps tend to the business when he returns from work. The clientel is varied and also very good, because I tend to them personally and my prices are easily accesible to everyone. My business generates earnings to support my family and my home; my goal is to increase sales and to improve my business (home), to feed my family and the support the studies of my son.

Loan Use: Purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts, skirts, socks, pocketbooks, hairpins.

Mi nombre es Marta T., me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva de dama y caballero en mi negocio se venden pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, fajas, calsonetas y ropa de niño, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años y esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, mi esposo me ayuda a atender el negocio cuando el regresa de su trabajo, la clientela es variada y muy buena ya que los atiendo personalmente y los precios de venta son accesibles a la comunidad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder mantener mi familia y mi hogar, mi meta es poder incrementar mi ventas y asi poder acondicionar mejor mi negocio (casa), la alimentacion de mi familia y el estudio de mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, fajas, casonetas, bolsas, ganchos

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.en:
My name is Maria R., I make and sell food, in my business I sell breakfasts, lunches, and I also sell snacks such as bread with beans, baleadas-Honduran tacos, tortillas with cheese, enchiladas, tacos and cakes). I have the help of my daughters to attend to my clients, my clientel is good and my business is located at a stop for the bus terminal. My business generates earnings to cover family expenses. My goal is to be able to increase my sales, and with the earnings I can improve my home, support my family and finance the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of chicken, pork, oil, lard, tortillas, bread, beans, salt, spices, salsas, tomatoe sauces, cheese, vegetables, sodas, water, juices, butter, margarine, chile, eggs and ham.

Mi nombre es Maria R., me dedico a la produccion y venta de comida, en mi negocio se venden desayunos, y almuerzos, tambien vendo golosinas como ser pan con frijoles, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, enchiladas, tacos, pastelitos. Tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para atender a los clientes, y mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi negocio queda a la par de una terminal de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, mi meta es poder incrementar mis ventas y con la ganacia que obtenga poder hacerle mejoras a mi casa de habitacion, sustentar a mi familia y proporcionarle estudios a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de carne de pollo y cerdo, aceite, manteca, tortillas, pan, frijoles, sal, especias, salsinas, salsa de tomate, quesillo, vegetales, refrescos, agua, jugos, mantequilla, margarina, chile, huevos, jamon

loans.name: Mirna Ligia

texts.en:
My name is Mirna Curvas, I have been in charge of renting apartments for one year. My husband helps me with the construction of the apartments, those I rent apartments to are family aquaintances. My business helps me to feed my family and my goal is to finish the apartments and to begin building others and with the earnings I can sustain my family and the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of construction material: cement, sand, water, lime, putty, doors and paint.

Mi nombre es Mirna C., me dedico al alquiler de apartamentos, tengo mis apartamentos desde hace 1 año, mi esposo me ayuda con la construccion de los apartamentos, mi inquilinos son personas conocidas de mi familia, mi negocio me ayuda para la alimentacion de mi familia, mi meta es poder terminar mi apartamento y poder empezar a construir otro y con las ganancias poder sustentar mi familia y el estudio de mis nietos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion, cemento, arena, agua, cal, masilla, puertas, pintura

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.en:
My name is Carlos F., I drive(taxi) people to different places in the city of Tegucigalpa. I have had my business for 3 years. My clients are numerous since I am positioned at a taxi stop. My business generates earnings that allows me to support my wife, my children and to cover home expenses. My goal is to repair my car to give better service to my customers, and with the earnings, buy another vehicle, to support my family and to finance the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase spare auto parts and tires.

Mi nombre es Carlos F., me dedico al negocio de transportar personas a diferentes lugares de la ciudad de tegucigalpa, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que yo estoy en un punto de taxis, mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder mantener a mi esposa y mis hijos y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar, mi meta es poder arreglar mi automovil para poder dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganacias comprarme otro vehiculo, mantener a mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos automotrices y llantas

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Maria del Socorro is a 42 year old woman, she is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Since she was young she likes sales. In the beginning, she only sold shoes that her brother made, but last year she complemented her sales by offering products such as nutritional complements (Herbalife) and has seen such excitement from her clients. She started her business in order to be self-sufficient and support her family, because her children were little kids at that time.

Nowadays her clients who buy nutritional complements have been increased and that why she is requesting a loan of $475 USD for working capital to invest in merchandise and to be able to supply the orders requested by her clients. She wants to repay in a term of 3-6 months.

ESPAÑOL

Maria del Socorro es una mujer de 42 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es un trabajador del área de la construcción. Desde joven a ella le han gustado las ventas, inicio hace 17 años con las ventas de zapatos que fabricaba su hermano, pero desde hace un año complementa sus ventas ofreciendo productos que son complementos alimenticios (Herbalife) y tiene mucha aceptación entre sus clientes. Ella inicio su negocio con la idea de tener ingresos propios y ayudar a su familia, ya que sus hijos estaban muy pequeños en aquél tiempo.

Hoy en día se han incrementado sus clientes que le compran los complementos alimenticios y es por eso que solicita un crédito por $ 475 USD para capital de trabajo, para comprar inventario de productos y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrece pagarlo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Isabel was born in Torreon, Coahuila, and she has lived in Monterrey for 15 years with two children. She started a business selling floral adjustment and handmade articles; she also sells clothes with Peter who is her husband. They are a very hard working family with a lot of business experience. Isabel learned to make handmade articles from friends and she knows that this activity will enable her to grow her income to help her support her home. Now she needs additional credit to invest in raw materials in order to elaborate her floral arrangements in preparation for “the died day” (this is a traditional festival in Mexico on November 1st and 2nd ). During this festival, she has a lot of demand of her products. Isabel is a very enthusiastic entrepreneurial woman and she wants to work hard to grow her business.

SPANISH

Isabel nació en Torreón, Coahuila, y tiene Quince años viviendo en Monterrey, es madre de dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de arreglos florales y manualidades, además de compartir un negocio de venta de ropa con su esposo Pedro, son una familia muy trabajadora y con grandes habilidades de comerciantes. Ella aprendió a hacer manualidades con amigas y después vio que esta actividad le podría dar ganancias para colaborar a los ingresos del hogar. Ahora solita el crédito para hacer una inversión en materiales para la elaboración de “coronas de muerto” para el próximo 1 y 2 de noviembre, ya que vive cerca de un panteón y es una temporada en donde ella hace muchas de estas piezas para venderlas a las afueras del mismo. Es una empresaria muy entusiasta y tiene muchas ganas de crecer junto con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for her business

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
My name is Jose A., and my job is repairing and selling bicycles. I have had my business for one year and it is located in the city of Danli. The business began through my own efforts, and I have the help of my son to repair the bicycles. My clientel is very good as the majority of people here use bicycles as a primary means of transportation. My business has generated earnings to support my family and my goal is to be able to increase my inventory, by which enabling me to increase sales and repair more bicycles and with my earnings improve my business (home) and to cover family expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase spare bicycle parts, glue, patches, tires, seats, air pumps, brakes.

Mi nombre es Jose A., me dedico a la reparacion y venta de bicicletas, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, actividad que inicie con esfuerzo propio, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la reparacion de las bicicletas, mi clientela es muy buena ya que la mayoria de la gente aqui las utiliza para medio de transporte, mi negocio me genera ganancias para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario y asi poder vender y reparar mas bicicletas y con las ganancias hacerle mejoras a mi negocio (casa) y cubrir con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos de bicicletas, pegamentos, parches, llantas, asientos, bombas de aire, balineras, frenos

payments.comment: En esta epoca de verano las personas buscan reparar sus bicicletas para salir a la playa o pasear en el pueblo por lo que necesito comprar mas respuestos para atender a las personas que me busquen, gracias por su ayuda y mi negocio ha mejorado mucho.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Jose is 50 years old and spent 30 years managing a scrap iron business, where he buys and sells them. He is married and lives with his wife who is a housewife, all his sons are married. He started the business when he was fired from his job. At that time, he decided to be a retailer, and he was noticing that this activity could make him good earnings, allowing him to imrpove his home economy. Now he needs a credit to replace his old truck for another one with more capacity, and with this he will obtain more earnings because he can buy more scrap iron. He will also make more sales in a recycling company and this company will buy all that he offers.

SPANISH

El Señor José Guadalupe tiene 50 años de edad y 30 de dedicarse a la compra y venta de chatarra, es casado y vive con su esposa que se dedica a las labores del hogar, todos sus hijos están casados, el se inicio en el negocio al verse desempleado y no contar con un oficio que poder trabajar, decidió convertirse en comerciante, y poco a poco fue notando que era una actividad que podía dejarle buenas ganancias, mismas que eran necesarias para llevar el sustento al hogar, ahora requiere el crédito para sustituir su camioneta por otra con mas capacidad, lo cual traerá como beneficio mayores ingresos ya que podrá recolectar mas chatarra e incrementar sus ventas, ya que el la vende con una empresa recicladora y esta compra toda la que el le lleve.

loans.use: Purchase a better truck for the business

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Araceli is from Veracruz and has 7 years living in Monterrey. She changed her city looking for a better life for her family. She is married and has three children, her husband currently works as a driver in a company. Araceli started her business because she wants to obtain an additional income for her home and to help her husband with the family expenses. At the beginning, she just had a few merchandise but with the pass of the time, her business has grown and transformed into a little store. Looking at the needs of her neighbors, she started to sell fruits and vegetables. Now she needs a credit to invest in her inventory and so she can have more merchandise to offer to her clients.

SPANISH

La Sra. Araceli es originaria de Veracruz y tiene 7 años viviendo en la ciudad de Monterrey, ella cambio su lugar de residencia para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es casada y madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa. Ella inicio su negocio para generar un ingreso adicional a su hogar y ayudar así con los gastos familiares, al principio solo tenia poca mercancía pero con el paso del tiempo noto que su negocio iba creciendo hasta que se convirtió en una tiendita, y debido a las necesidades de sus vecinos comenzó a vender frutas y verduras. Ahora ella requiere el crédito para incrementar su inventario y tener mayor mercancía que ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lucia Antonieta

texts.en:
My name is Lucia Z., I produce and sell nacatamales(Honduran specialty), and snacks such as tortillas with cheese, baleadas(Honduran taco), bread with beans, burritos and pancakes. I have had my business for 5 years, my children help me make the nacatamales and my earnings allow me to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and invest the profits in improving my home, supporting my family and the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase cornflour, chicken, pork, rice, beans, sugar, cheese, quesillo(traditional white Latin American cheese), oil, butter, salt, spices, sodas, eggs

Mi nombre es Lucia Z., me dedico a la produccion de nacatamales y venta de golosinas como ser tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, pan con frijoles, burritas, panqueques, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, mis hijos me ayudan a la elaboracion de los nacatamales, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mis ventas y las ganacias invertirlas en mejoras a la casa, mantenimiento de mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, carne de pollo y cerdo, arroz, frijoles, azucar, queso, quesillo, aceite, manteca, sal, especias, refrescos, huevos

loans.name: Nellys Maria

texts.en:
My name is Nellys J., I sell clothing such as blouses, T-shirts, shoes, hairpins, and brushes. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in the city of Danli. Due to the death of my father, I have had to look for other means to support my home and family. My goal is to increase my inventory and to improve sales and with the profits, I can remodel the house, make sure my family is fed and to finance the studies of my younger brothers.

Loan Use: Purchase clothing, shoes, combs, hairpins, brushes, blouses, T-shirts.

Mi nombre es Nellys J., me dedico a la venta de ropa como ser camisas, camisetas, zapatos, ganchos de pelo, cepillos para pelo, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, debido a la muerte de mi padre he tenido que buscar como sustentar mi casa y mi familia, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario y asi poder tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias poder remodelar mi casa, atender las necesidades alimenticias de mi familia y el estudio de mis hermanitos.

loans.use: Compra de ropa, zapatos, tenedores, ganchos de pelo, cepillos, camisas, camisetas

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.en:
My name is Maria I., I sell ice cream, frozen fruits, fruit cakes, and ice cream cones. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in the city of Danli. My children help me in the store and my earnings help cover family expenses. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, improve my business, support my family as well as a provide a quality education for my children.

Loan Use: Purchase ice cream, sticks, fruits, cups, bags, sugar, colorants, cones.

Mi nombre es Maria I., me dedico a la venta de ice cream, paletas de frutas, charamuscas de frutas, conos, tengo mi necogio hace 3 años y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para la atencion de los clientes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia, mi meta es poder aumentar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con la ganancia que obtenga poder acondicionar mejor mi negocio, sustentar la alimentacion de mi familia y un buen estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de ice cream, paletas, frutas, vasos, bolsas, azucar, colorantes, conos,

payments.comment: En esta epoca de calor mi negocio mejora sus ventas, por lo que necesito surtir mi negocio para vender mas helados y generar mas ganacias, gracias por su ayuda.

loans.name: Nancy Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Nancy G., I make and sell tortillas. I have had had my business for 5 years. My business is in my home and my clientel are my neighbors and people who order more than 100 tortillas for parties, birthday parties and celebrations. My business creates earnings enough to feed my family, and my goal is to increase my inventory of cornflour to be able to produce larger quantities of tortillas and with my profits, to remodel my home (business), support my family and most importantly, fincance the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase cornflour, salt, lime, water, firewood, lights, carbon.

Mi nombre es Nancy G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio desde hace 5 años y esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, mi clientela son mis vecinos y gente que me encarga mas de 100 tortillas para alguna fiesta o celebracion de cumpleaños, mi negocio me genera ingresos para la alimentacion de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de harina de maiz para poder producir mayores cantidades de tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa (negocio), mantener a mi familia y lo mas importante el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, carbon, leña

loans.name: Longuino

texts.en:
Mr. Longuino S. is a Carpenter. He has a lot of experience in the field and has 6 years working in his workshop. When he started his workshop, he didn't have any tools, but he ran the workshop very well.

At the present time, he would like to buy more tools to work faster, and so he plans to buy an air compressor and a circular saw. These tools will give him the opportunity to make more wood furniture and sell it.

Mr. Longuino sells in local markets on the streets and in flea markets. Those are his natural markets and he is very successful selling there. For this reason, Mr Longuino is asking for a loan of $850,00 Dlls, and is committed to paying back the loan in a period of 6 to 12 months. With this money, he will buy the tools he needs and additional wood material. This will give him the opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

ESPANOL

El Sr. Longuino S. es Carpintero, instaló su taller de carpintería hace 6 años cuenta con mucha experiencia en el ramo, cuando abrio su taller, lo hizo con la unica herramienta con la que el contaba en ese momento y ha funcionado bien pero se ha percatado de que el negocio marcharia mejor,si tuviera mejor herramienta por lo cual quiere comprar una sierra de banco y una compresora para pintar los muebles, de esta manera trabajaria mas rapido y con mejor calidad, esto tambien le daria la oportunidad de fabricar una mayor cantidad de muebles domesticos los cuales vende sobre ´pedido y en los mercados conocidos como pulgas. Por ello el Sr.Longuino solicita un crédito de $850.00 Dlls, pagaderos en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses con el cual planea comprar herramienta, que consiste en una sierra de banco y una compresora, con este equipo planea incrementar su venta y fabricación, de esta manera el podra dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use:
power tools, air compressor and circular saw,
wood material

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani lives in the Kigogo area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She runs a food vending business near her residence. She wants to improve her business by adding some hygienic food supply materials, cleaning materials and food packaging materials (for take-away).

The demand for food has risen, especially during evening where Moslems get ifter. Shani is in need of USD 400 to facilitate her plans.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jafari

texts.en:
Jafari lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with two children. He owns a retail shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items, especially food items.

Jafari plans to open another shop on the next street over. Through his savings, he has managed to pay rent for the premises. What he needs now is working capital to fill the shelves of the new shop. The holy month of Ramadan had created high demand for food items. The new shop will add a profit margin to his total income. The aim being to sustain the family and pay for school fees for his children. To implement his plans, Jafari needs USD 1000 as a working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mwazani lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. Mwazani owns a small tailoring mart and she has employed two assistants to help her. She has had entrepreneurship training and small business management from Youth Self Emloyment Foundation (YOSEFO).

Mwazani is on the path to expanding her business. To succeed in this, she needs to add two sewing machines, employ one more assistant, and increase the stock of sewing materials. This business expansion will help her increase her income, thus meet consumption expenditures, including school fees for her children. Mwazan is in need of USD 950.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felister lives in Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with seven children. Felister owns three retail shops selling general consumable items. She is in the process of opening the fourth shop. She had a training in entrepreneurship and small business development from YOSEFO.

She has two assistants who help with the shops and she wants to employ one more assistant. Felista is usually faced with stockouts due to inadequate working capital. The expansion will even demand more working capital. To implement her ideas she needs USD 1000.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is married with five children. She lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a retail shop selling different consumable items.

She needs her business to run smoothly by having enough stock of goods and this is a great challenge right now. The demand for general items has risen in her area, partly caused by the month of Ramadan. She needs USD 750 to facilitate her mission.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Telma Josefina

texts.en:
Mrs. Thelma is married and her husband is a fisherman. She started her business two years ago in her house, in order to complement the family income, selling clothes to her friends and she got clients very fast. Now she rents a place in a local market and her merchandise is well accepted by people.

She is requesting a loan of $700 USD to stock up on merchandise for the upcoming Christmas season. When her selling increases, she thinks she be able to repay the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

La señora Thelma esta casada y su esposo es pescador, inicio su negocio hace dos años, en su casa, con el propósito de complementar el ingreso familiar, vendiendo ropa a sus amigos y muy rápido empezó a hacerse de clientela. Actualmente renta un local en un mercado y sus mercancías son muy bien aceptadas por la gente.

Esta solicitando un crédito por $ 700 USD para surtirse de mercancía para la próxima temporada navideña, época en que se incrementan sus ventas, piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Nine years ago, Mrs. Gloria started selling shoes by catalog in order to earn additional income to support her family's expenses. Now, this activity has transformed into the most important one in her family's economy since she separated from her husband (four years ago) and has more expenses to pay for.

Mrs. Gloria also began to prepare “homemade meals” for the people who work near her house and she is well accepted by her clients. She has three children and one of them helps her by taking orders by telephone and delivering meals.

Doña Gloria is asking for a loan of $250 USD to buy shoes as well as raw materials for the meals that she prepares. She will repay the loan in a term of 3-6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

La señora Gloria se inició vendiendo zapatos por catalogo desde hace nueve años con el propósito de poder contar con un ingreso adicional para apoyar los gastos de su familia, sin embargo al pasar el tiempo esta actividad se fue haciendo mas importante dentro de la economía de su familia, ya que desde hace cuatro años esta separada de su esposo y ahora es la cabeza de la familia y tiene que realizar mas gastos. Con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos desde hace mas de un año que inicio la elaboración de comidas caseras, ofreciéndolas en las oficinas que se encuentran cerca de su casa y ha tenido muy buena aceptación. Ella tiene tres hijos y uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio, recibiendo los pedidos telefónicos y entregándolos a domicilio.

Doña Gloria solicita un préstamo por $250 USD para destinar una parte para comprar zapatos y la otra para abastecerse de materias primas para las comidas que elabora. Solicita un plazo para pagar de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: to buy shoes and raw materials

loans.name: Fausto Juventino

texts.en:
Five years ago, Fausto was working as a contractor, it was a very hard work and for that reason he began to feel ill. Fausto’s friends recommended that he take a nutritional complement to improve his health. After he took it and when he saw the results, he began to recommend it to his family and friends and started his own nutritional complement business. At this time, he had the support of both his wife and child, and one hundred percent of his family income is currently coming from his business.

At this time, Fausto needs a loan to invest in merchandise because he needs to be prepared for Christmas time when his sales increase. He needs to supply merchandise for a total amount of $925 USD and he is determined to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. He knows that if he increases his inventory, he will be able to sell more and this will ultimately increase his profits.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace mas de 5 años, Fausto se desempeñaba como Contratista (Albañil) un trabajo muy pesado, por el que comenzó a padecer problemas de salud. Fue así como le recomendaron unos productos naturales para que le ayudaran a resolver sus problemas. Viendo los resultados y convencido de que el producto es bueno, empezó a recomendarlo entre familiares y amigos, iniciando así su negocio propio de distribución de productos naturales. A la fecha colaboran con él su esposa y uno de sus hijos, siendo este giro la fuente de ingresos familiares al 100%.

En estos momentos Fausto necesita un crédito para invertir en mercancía, pues a finales de año se incrementan las ventas y necesita estar preparado. Necesita invertir mercancía por un total del $925 USD; crédito que esta dispuesto a pagar en 6 meses, pues al aumentar sus inventarios, esta en condiciones de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Improve on the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Business

loans.name: Anyango

texts.en:
Anyango C. and Malingo Grace are married women. This ladies after their education in higher institution lacked jobs and decided to start up a business of a retail shop with the little capital they had of $150 as a joint business.

They started this business in 2005 and currently they are having a capital of $ 300. There business is located in a very strategic place where by they have got a number of customers, but only that they have not every type of commodity in the shop.

They therefore request for a loan of $ 800 to enable them acquire the variety of commodities, so as to meet the demand of their customers.

loans.use: To improve on Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish up the building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on the stock.

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.en:
Maria Olivia is married and has 3 sons. When her children began to grow up, they began to have expenses. Maria's husband is a fisherman and his income is not fixed.

Maria decided to help her husband with the family income while working in a job that allowed her to stay with her sons. Maria used the little savings that she had in 2002 to invest in selling clothes to her friends. She began to have success.

Little by little, demand grew and her clients wanted clothes with better quality. For this reason, she travels at least once every two months to Belize to purchase her merchandise. She needs credit to invest in merchandise for the Christmas season and to allow her business to continue growing.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

María Olivia está casada y tiene 3 hijos, cuando sus hijos comenzaron a crecer, también los gastos aumentaron; su esposo es Pescador y los ingresos no son fijos, por lo que ella tomo la decisión de apoyarlo con los gastos familiares, en un oficio que le permitiera estar al pendiente de sus hijos. Fue así como con la inversión de los ahorros con los que contaba en el 2002, comenzó a vender ropa nueva entre sus familiares y amigos con muy buena aceptación. Poco a poco le fueron solicitando mas mercancía y de mejor calidad, por lo que a la fecha por lo menos una vez cada 2 meses, realiza un viaje a un poblado cercando en Belice, para surtir mercancía. A la fecha necesita un crédito pues hacia finales de año, se incrementan las ventas por lo que necesita estar preparada. Es por lo anterior que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 550 a 6 meses. El cual le permitirá surtir mercancía suficiente para la temporada navideña y mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Delta Alicia

texts.en:
Delta Alicia is a young woman who is 35 years old. Four years ago, she lost her husband and was left in charge of the education and expenses of her children. With few resources, the first thing that she thought to do was to sell food. So, with a small investment she started to sell food between her neighborhoods.

With the passage of the time, she was able to obtain a little food store restaurant in front of her house. Now she wants to purchase live animals, like turkeys and pigs, to prepare and sell for Christmas and New Year's dinners. This investment will allow her to maintain her income level through the rest of the year as this season the food she commonly sells must be offered cheaper. She comments that her experience of previous years has helped her to learn to take advantage of the opportunity of this season and, for that reason, she needs a credit of US$ 550 hopping to repay this loan in 6 months (at least).

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Delta Alicia es una mujer joven de 35 años que en el 2002, sufrió la perdida de su esposo, quedando a cargo de la manutención y educación de sus 3 hijos menores. Con pocos recursos, lo primero que se le ocurrió fue el vender comida, y así con una mínima inversión comenzó a vender alimentos preparados entre sus vecinos, con buena aceptación. Poco a poco fue avanzando en la actividad hasta tener una pequeña lonchería en la entrada de su casa. Por estas fechas Delta esta interesada en comprar animales en pie: Pavos y Cerdos, los cuales piensa vender ya preparados para la cena de navidad y de año nuevo. Esta inversión le permitirá solventar sus principales gastos económicos pues en estas fechas las ventas normales bajan. Comenta que la experiencia de años anteriores le ha enseñado a sacar ventaja de la oportunidad que se le presenta, es por lo anterior que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 550 a 6 meses, para estar preparada y poder aprovechar la temporada con alimentos diferentes a lo que habitualmente ella vende.

loans.use: Alive animals purchase

loans.name: María Elidé

texts.en:
Maria is married to Ruben Angel Tun. Ruben was born in Ticul, a little town distinguished because many of its people work in shoe manufacturing. Because of this, Ruben learned shoe manufacturing 30 years ago.

Maria is very enterprising and she learned the same occupation as her husband. They now both handle their small business with 20 years of experience manufacturing shoes. They have three children and their business is the only source of their family's income.

Maria is requesting a loan for $375 USD to pay back over a term of 3-6 months to supply her business with raw materials and be prepared for Christmas sales. She is planning to set up her business formally in a permanent place in the future.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

María esta casada con Rubén Ángel Tun un Yucateco originario de Ticul, un poblado que se distingue porque la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la Fabricación de calzado; oficio que Rubén conoce desde hace mas de 30 años. María es muy emprendedora, por lo que al ver trabajar a su esposo ella también aprendió el oficio y entre los dos manejan su microempresa con 20 años de antigüedad en la Fabricación de calzado. De su matrimonio María procreo a tres hijos, siendo el negocio, la única fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.

Esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $375 USD a 3-6 meses para poder surtirse de materias primas y estar preparada para las ventas navideñas. Tiene como proyecto a futuro poder establecer formalmente su negocio en un local fijo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Fidelia De Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Fidelia de Jesus E.. I am a seamstress for all kinds of things. I specialize in bedding. I’ve had my business for five years, and my income allows me to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and my production, and with my earnings be able to buy another electric sewing machine. That way, I’ll be able to hire a seamstress to help me make clothes, keep supporting my family and give my children an education.

Loan Use: Purchase of fabric, thread, sponges, pins, pencils, and needles.

Mi nombre es Fidelia de Jesus E., me dedico a todo tipo de costura, mi fuerte es la fabricacion de ropa para camas, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio y este me genera ganancias para poder sustentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios asi mismo mi produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otra maquina de costurar electrica para poder contratar una costurera para que me ayude en la fabricacion de la ropa, tambien poder sustentar a mi familia y darles educacion a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de tela, hilo, esponja, broches, lapices, agujas,

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Mi nombre es Paula V., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo 5 años de dedicarme a mi negocio, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para el empaque de las tortillas, mi negocio me genera ganancias para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una persona para que me ayude a la fabricacion de las tortillas, y poder mantener el sustento de mi familia.

ENGLISH

My name is Paula V., I am dedicated to producing and selling tortillas!. I've been at it 5 years. My children help me package the tortillas and the business provides for the sustenance of us all. My goal is to increase inventory to have a greater production and with the profits I hope to be able to contract a person so that to help me to the manufacture of tortillas, and to be able to support the sustenance of my family.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos, bolsas

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a married woman and has one son. Her husband is working as a hammock salesman and, as this is an unstable business, she must help with the family's expenses. Three years ago she made a decision to help her family's economy so she used an empty space at her home to raise chickens and sell them. Now her husband is a driver and Cayetana administrates two businesses. She is looking for a credit of US$200 dollars because in December she increases her sales. She needs to invest right now in order to allow her the time to raise all of the chickens and to make more money. She has very high expectations because people know her and always come to the business to buy her chickens and hammocks as well.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Cayetana es una mujer casada, su esposo se dedicaba a la venta de hamacas, siendo este un oficio un poco inestable, ella tiene la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos familiares pues tiene 1 hijo menor. Hace 3 años tomo la decisión de apoyar económicamente, contando con espacio en su domicilio particular, comenzó a criar pollos para su venta. Ahora su esposo se contrato como chofer cargador y es ahora Cayetana quien atiende los 2 negocios. Esta interesada en obtener un préstamo por la cantidad de US$200 dólares a 6 meses pues en Diciembre se incrementan las ventas. Necesita hacer la inversión ahora pues el pollo tiene un periodo de crecimiento para poder engordarlos y venderlos a buen precio. Sus expectativas son buenas, pues la gente ya los conoce y vienen a buscarlos de otros lugares para comprar tanto hamacas como pollos.

loans.use: chickens raise and sale

loans.name: Socorro Maribel

texts.en: Mi nombre es Socorro Z., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años Y mis hijos me ayudan a la venta, tengo clientes muy buenos y fijos ya que mis clientes son mis vecinos y tambien hago contrato con mercaditos y pulperias para la venta de las tortillas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las utilidades que tenga deseo hacer mejoras a mi casa, criar a mis hijos y sustentar de mi hogar

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, leña, fosforos, carbon, agua,

loans.name: Lucy Margarita

texts.en:
Luci Margarita U. D. and her husband, who is a farmer, have been dedicated to the culture of the Pitahaya and Havanan Chile for approximately 10 years in Kinchil, a small town located in Yucatan. The agriculture is the only way that they have to maintain their children.

They began this business because they love commerce and also out of economic necessity. In addition, Luci has been selling fresh chicken and vegetables for 4 years. She does not currently have enough capital, and for this reason she needs credit of US$925 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, tools and raw materials. This is important for their business because of the season and potential success in December with sales.

Luci is offering to repay the loan in 6 months, at least. All of this is done with the purpose of obtaining a better harvest to increase sales and Luci's family income.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Luci Margarita U. D. y su esposo que es agricultor, se dedican al cultivo de la Pitahaya y chile habanero desde hace aproximadamente 10 años en Kinchil, un poblado de Yucatán; la agricultura es el único medio que tienen ellos para el sustento de sus hijos, ellos empezaron este negocio por el gusto al comercio y la necesidad económica, además, vende pollo fresco y verduras desde hace 4 años. Por falta de capital Luci necesita un crédito de US$925 dólares americanos para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herramientas e insumos para su negocio en esta temporada que se avecina (Diciembre), ofreciendo pagarlo en por lo menos 6 meses. Todo esto con el fin de obtener una mejor cosecha, incrementar sus ventas y a su vez su ingreso familiar.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers,and tools

loans.name: Ruth Jacinta

texts.en:
Rutt Jacinta is from Merida, Yucatan. She has been dedicated for 40 years to the food sales business in her small store called “La Guadalupana”. She started her business by the request of her parents and also because she loves commerce. Now she hopes to transform this business with microcredit programs.

At the moment, she has two employees who help her in the store.
