Her small business is the only way she has to obtain income and, for this reason, she needs a credit by US$ 650 for her business to respond to the demand of her clients. Rutt needs to have a variety of products to be able to compete against other businesses similar to her own as well as to provide enough of her products in this season (December, which is an excellent month for sales).

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Rutt Jacinta que es originaria de Merida, Yucatán, se ha dedicado desde hace 40 años a la venta de comida en su Estanquillo “La Guadalupana”. Comenzo solo por petición de sus padres y el gusto al comercio y ahora lo ha hecho su forma de vida, Ruth espera poder desarrollar su negocio con apoyo de algún programa de Microcreditos. Actualmente cuenta con dos empleados que la apoyan, este estanquillo es el único ingreso con el que cuenta, es por eso que Rutt necesita un crédito por US$ 650 Dolares americanos ya que debido a la demanda de sus clientes necesita tener mas variedad de productos para poder competir , y mas en esta temporada (Diciembre) que es un excelente mes de venta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has two children. Her husband is a bricklayer and she started her business to obtain better incomes and to help with her family's expenses because her husband’s salary is not enough to cover all of the expenses. She took part of the money that was designated to cover the family expenses and decided to invest and start her retail business.

Janet needs to purchase merchandise because she wants to have stock for the Christmas season that, from her experience, is always when sales increase. It is for that reason that she needs a loan of US$ 475 American dollars that she will repay in 6 months, at least. Also, she hopes to collaborate with lenders.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Janet esta casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es obrero y ella inició su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y ayudar en el gasto familiar, porque el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanza para el mismo. Con parte del dinero destinado al gasto familiar, Janet decidió invertirlo y empezar con el negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes en general, ella necesita abastecerse de mercancía para poder ofrecer en esta temporada navideña que por lo general según su experiencia siempre incrementa sus ventas y desea estar lista para satisfacer su demanda, por ello esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 475 dólares los cuales se compromete a pagar en al menos 6 meses y espera le colaboren a crecer junto con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles is 31 years old and is married with two children. Her husband works in a gas station.

She started her business two years ago because her husband was paying for their house. Angeles is a very dynamic woman and, since she was a child, she learned about selling and doing business. She never thought that her business would be the unique source of income but this happened a year and a half ago when her husband was sick. He had a peritonitis and, for that reason, he was operated on for a colostomy . While living in this situation, she decided to work more tenaciously in her business and designed a new way of selling candies. She creates prizes when she sells to the kids outside of the school and she is well accepted.

Currently, her husband is working but he is probably going to be operated on again. For that reason, Maria de los Angeles wants to supply her business to keep her clients. She is requesting a loan for $ 475 USD to buy merchandise and she hopes to repay in a term of 4-8 months. She would like to get a mobile stand in the future to put outside the school.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

La señora Maria de los Angeles tiene 31 años de edad y esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera. Hace dos años inicio su negocio pues con el sueldo de su esposo estaban pagando su casa y como ella es una mujer muy dinámica que desde chica aprendió el negocio de las ventas, decidió contribuir al ingreso familiar dedicándose a la venta de dulces en su casa. Nunca pensó que su negocio sería su única fuente de ingresos como sucedió hace un año y medio en que su esposo se enfermó y le dio peritonitis, por lo que le tuvieron que hacer una operación de colostomía que tiempo después le causaría una hernia. Al vivir toda esta situación, decidió dedicarse con mas empeño en su negocio y diseño una nueva forma de vender sus dulces, elaborando premios que vende a los niños afuera de la escuela y que ha tenido una gran aceptación.

En estos momentos su esposo ya esta trabajando pero es muy probable que lo vuelvan a operar, por eso Maria de los Ángeles quiere surtir su negocio para que siga teniendo la misma aceptación, es por eso que solicita un préstamo por $ 475 USD para comprar mercancía y piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 4-8 meses. A ella le gustaría poder contar en un futuro con un puesto portátil para poner a la salida de la escuela.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Four years ago, Irma wanted to support her husband with the family’s expenses and she started to work in a small business preparing tacos (a typical meal). She is a 46 year old woman who is very active, her husband works in a factory, and they have three children. Two years ago, she decided to work by herself and now rents a small place in front of the main square of her town where she sells TACOS during a few hours each day. In addition to this activity, she sells bedspreads and sheets to her clients.

She is requesting a loan for $ 475 USD to buy raw materials to prepare the TACOS and she expects to repay in a term of 6-12 months. In the future, she would like to create a restaurant and offer a complete menu of meals all day long.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Hace cuatro años que Irma quiso apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia y comenzó a trabajar en un negocio preparando tacos (comida tipica), ella es una mujer de 46 años muy activa, su esposo trabaja en una fabrica y tienen tres hijos. Hace dos años se decidió a establecerse por su cuenta y actualmente renta un pequeño local enfrente de la plaza principal de su pueblo en donde ofrece la venta de TACOS durante parte del día. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, ella también vende sábanas y colchas entre sus clientes.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 USD para comprar materias primas que utiliza en la elaboración de los tacos, y piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses. En un futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante y poder ofrecer todo un menú de comidas a lo largo de todo el día.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio paid off his first loan through Kiva and Mifex successfully, and now he would like to take out a second microloan. His business is run out of his home, but on weekends he goes out into the local markets to sell with his son, while his daughter watches over the home operation. Mr. A. originally opened his business selling rice, sugar, oil, and greens, which are the most basic ingredients customers buy. Working every day of the week, Rogelio manages his business very carefully, and he has gained 20 years of experience. He continues day-in and day-out because he wants to provide for his family. With this follow-on loan, Rogelio plans to continue building and diversifying his inventory, buying items in cash so that he can receive discounts. The presence of formal banks is very small where Rogelio lives, and their application process is very cumbersome. He also does not want to borrow from the chulqueros or loan sharks. With this second loan Rogelio plans to buy rice, sugar, oil, and a display cabinet.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With this second loan Rogelio plans to buy rice, sugar, oil, and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Don Walter has successfully repaid his first loan, and he is now looking to extend his credit so that he can buy a freezer and other items used to prepare chicken. His mother and wife help run the business when he goes into town to sell his goods. With 30 years of experience, Walter has definitely grown over the years. Originally, he started out by selling a few select items on a table in front of his parents’ house. Competing lenders in his area charge 20%, and he had to pay daily! There are commercial banks that exist in his area, but they offer consumer loans and production loans if borrowers have guarantees (usually tangible assets). Without these resources, Mr. CasaG. is turning once again to Kiva and Mifex to keep his business growing.

He was afraid of being in debt with a loan. The loan sharks offer money, but the with the steep interest and daily payments, it was impossible for him to have access to credit. He invested the capital in the purchase of new inventory. The capital from Kiva helped him invest high-turnover products in wholesale and, more importantly, in cash. He feels this gave him an advantage in prices, which has helped him financially improve his daily life. Don Walter repaid his loan on time, and is now asking for another loan from Mifex and Kiva to continue investing in his business and providing the services his clients demand like meats and a freezer to keep his goods fresh.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Continue investing in his business and providing the services his clients demand like meats and a freezer to keep his goods fresh.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente finished his first loan with Kiva successfully. He says that his 10 years of experience have been a huge part of his success over the last six months. He initially began in this business shortly after getting married, and when he went to purchase shoes one day, he realized he could do better than most of the shoe salesmen around town. With $50 he opened up his shop and sold to people walking down the street. Vicente’s wife joined him in the store, and they have learned to take advantage of the holidays and weekends because those are the busiest times at the outdoor markets near their house. Mr. Z. has been especially entrepreneurial, seeking out some of the best artisans in his area to make shoes which he sells. However, this level of customization requires cash up front. The relationship between Vicente and his shoemakers is very close as they rely on him to sell shoes so they can maintain their daily subsistence, and it is important to Vicente so he can have a profitable business.

Mr. Z. is asking for his second loan so that he buy athletic shoes, artisan-made shoes, as well as two display cases to show off his inventory.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Mr. Zumba is asking for his second loan so that he buy athletic shoes, artisan-made shoes, as well as two display cases to show off his inventory.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is asking for a second loan after having successfully repaid her first. It helped her to grow her business and develop relationships with the producers from whom she gets her chickens. With the loan she received she was able to purchase a sign for her stand and also buy poultry in bulk. At the market she has a great location near the entrance and her business has been able to keep up with the demand of clients. Her personality and relationship with her customer is a great plus for her business. She was very grateful to receive the loan from Mifex and Kiva because she no longer had to rely on informal lenders for credit. She feels much more secure financially and hopes she can continue participating in this program.

Her parents left her in charge of their business, and Martha has been a very responsible manager. She says that without the guidance fro her father, who taught her the business, she would be where she is today. When she got married, Ms. A. did not quit the business, but continued so that she and her husband could bring in two sources of income. Starting out by selling 1-2 chickens per day on the street corner, Martha has surely come a long way, selling 20-30 chickens on average. Her day starts at 6 a.m. and she usually finished up selling in the market by 2 p.m. With this second loan Martha wants to purchase utensils and a refrigerator.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With this second loan Martha wants to purchase utensils and a refrigerator.

loans.use: Dorcas wants to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: Veronica wants to buy a donkey and a cart
